name: Melides Beach
description: Beautiful place a few steps from the ocean. Popular with campervan folks. Access by a sandy road, two wheel drive without issues. Better suited for smaller vehicles. No facilities, but there is a restaurant nearby and an official campsite not far from here.

name: Praia da Raposeira
description: Beautiful beach with strong waves. Parking either on a paved parking lot or on packed dirt closer to the beach. Access by a potholed dirt road, last few kms on a paved road (tiles missing every now and then, watch out) . When we were here there were plenty other campers, mostly from Germany. Expect younger crowd in converted box trucks, rather than retired couples. No facilities, but some of the folks camped here offered a surfboard for rent :)

name: Farol do Cabo Espichel
description: Plenty of space around the lighthouse or by the nearby monastery. Windy, but amazing sunset and quiet at night. There is a snack bar by the monastery, no facilities by the lighthouse. Free.

name: Barragem Do Arade
description: Free camping at two area close to reservoir one area below dam on flat ground and one at top of dam with some views of lake. No facilities but peaceful rural area with great walks.

name: Barragem Pego Do Altar
description: Free parking next to lake, three area one at top of hill near restaurant/toilets, larger area at bottom of hill overlooking lake and additional area at end of dam all flat.  If you have a smaller vehicle or 4wd you can also drive down a dirt trackand park right next to the water.  There are free hot showers, toilets, cassette emptying point, water, bar/restaurant with very reasonable prices and wifi.  Beautiful spot, great walks and peaceful.

name: Parking Praia Do Mos
description: Parking and overnight possible in front of the sea. 2 restaurants nearby. Quiet, and the ocean can be wavy.

name: Barragem De Roxo Parking
description: Small parking area next to lake and just before dam.  Hard standing but possibilities to park on dirt tracks nearer the water.  Free to stay and dustbins and running water which states not drinkable quiet spot little traffic passes by.

name: Praia Do Cordoama
description: Small parking at the end of a road, going from Vila do Bispo. Good surf there, restaurant and surf center (surf center during high season). Toilets of the restaurant can be used when the restaurant is open.

name: Barragem Do Divor
description: lots of wild camping spots before and after dam under trees overlooking lake lovely setting great walks. Bin on site and free service point at Evora Intermarche if required.

name: Praia do Amado
description: Big beach for surfers, also a surf school, restaurant and toilets. Gets crowded, even in shoulder season. The parking space is big.

name: Praia da Ingrina
description: Few parking lots well dispersed with a nice ocean view. The beach is just a few meters away and you could have a nice swim there. Also there's a little restaurant by the beach. Pretty quiet.

name: Parking Close To The Train Station
description: Pay parking, 1,5€ per 24h, close to the train station. Safe place, some noise from the train, but didn't disturb our sleep. Walking distance to the city center, and maybe 15 minutes walking to the historical center. A cafeteria is available at the train station.

name: Praia Arda Afife
description:
Small beach parking. During the season, water, toilets and showers are available. Surfing is possible there. 
One of the best beach in north Portugal

name: Costa De Lavos Service area
description: Service area with toilets, showers, (only during the season) water and place to dispose the gray water. Right on the beach. Nice village to see, Casa dos Pescadores to be visited.

name: Praia Baleal
description: A huge parking right on the beach with nice gentle waves for surf beginners. Some bars and restaurants around. Water also available on the other side of the parking lot. Toilets available at the bar (without paying) at the end of the parking lot.

name: Camping Lisboa
description: huge huge place in the hills outside the city. lots of trees and grass. lower flat section for rigs w/hookups, steeper hillside in the forest for tents or vans. room for 1800 so mileage may vary noise-wise. facilities cleanish and showers hot. bar cafe minimarket wifi

name: Barragem De Povoa
description: A free aire with official parking at the entrance next to service point and wc/showers.  Lots of other spots right by the lake.  Bar/restaurant a few minutes walk.  BBQ areas, picnic tables. Beautiful lake with fishing./swimming.    Good dog walking/hiking.  Nisa town with all supermarkets about 10km.  Can stay as longs you like.   Can get busy at weekends/bank holidays. But sill a nice spot

name: Algarve Motorhome Park
description: Nice "camping" for motor homes and camper vans. There are warm showers for .50 euros for 5 minutes but no bathrooms. Must be self contained. Well laid out flat gravel parkings and some spots with shade. Electricity, water and dump station; washing machines 4.50 euros per load.  5 minutes from a very nice beach. 9 euro with electricity for 2 people and camper; price goes down if stay more nights.

name: Vila Nova Da Cerveira
description: A nice service area closed to Rio Minho, very close to the city and nice tapas and restaurants. Water and black water discharge available. Toilets might be available during the season.

name: Beach Lot At Praia Da Rocha
description: Big dirt parking lot by the a long sandy beach, some short trees that you could put a hammock.

name: Near Belver
description: Hilltop wild camping site overlooking river with castle directly opposite. Just  off the road leading down to the Alamal River Club on the south side of the river Tejo, opposite castle Belver, there is a rough track leading up to an old abandoned building with a flat grassy/gravelly camping area. No facilities but lovely views with plenty of peace and quiet.

name: Rocha Delicada Parking
description: A big round parking place at the end of a gravel road. Peaceful in natural surrounding and a little beach right next to it. Only a few locals were here.

name: Camping Ingrina
description: Rural camping for €6.50 per person. A little rough and ready but friendly people and lovely walks to Ingrina and Barranco beaches. If you're looking for a modern campsites with lots of facilities and activities then this is not for you.

name: Clearing at a steam
description:
A very peaceful an quiet place in a little valley. It is near to a very less used gravel road. Also when it is very hot on the flat land it will be a few degrees colder here. 
Only 5km from Rudis Pizzaparty!

name: Bike Mechanic
description: Good mechanic near Vianna. Sorted my clutch quickly to keep me moving

name: LPG Gas + Adaptors
description: A small GPL gas station with a friendly owner who speaks good english and also sells a kinds of filling adaptors!

name: Dinosaur footprints
description: A nice place in natural surroundings at the dinosaur tracks. You can follow the signs from the main road leading to a gravel road. It is very washed out and there were some tough sections for our 2wd van but the place is worth it. Very few people came to visit it so we could enjoy the silence. 180° sea view and the marked place is almost level.

name: Fonte do Mouro
description: Controlled spring water

une aire gratuite avec vidange eau potable 7/8 places
free area water 7/8 places

name: Porto Covo 2
description:
Because the other point is under construction, we found this spot. 

Parking lot at a sea lookout. Quiet during the night. A few beaches around, which you can reach by trails. Free Motorhome parking and service in town. But this land is for sale.

name: Bicycle and motorcycle mechanic
description: Tiny shop in the village of Pampilhosa. Local guy works there alone. He only speaks portugese...

name: Turiscampo camping bungalow park
description: Very good campsite. Outdoor pool, indoor pool, restaurant, bar and spa. Pitches are big.

name: Praia de Armacao de Pera Camping
description: Big camp place in the middle of town.  Really good price!!!

name: porto covo
description: parking space right by the sea. Quite and a few other campers were there

name: Parque Biologico Gaia
description: 7 motorhome simple pitches with 8,4mx4,0m (€4/night) and 2 double pitches (€6/night) w/ 15,6mx4,0m, electric hookups. Plus each adult €4, each child €2. Cars only €2. Pets only by leash. 10 kms away from Underground in Republica Avenue in Gaia. Phone +351 227 878 120. All bookings by e-mail : atendimento@parquebiologico.pt. You can download the digital leaflet on the website www.parquebiologico.pt

name: Centro Náutico De Monsaraz
description: Very nice spot on mixed parking. Small beach and restaurant. Beach shower and toilets during the day. Nice spot for some windusrfing or supping.

name: Praia Fluvial de Muinho
description: Along a river, natural swimming zone, wc, showers (cold), snack. Dumping and water.

name: Hostel 18
description:
ADMIN NOTE: User reports, location is incorrect. Please check in and correct GPS coordinates. 

If you're looking for an inexpensive Hostel just to spoil yourself in or even just to take a break from camping, then this is it.  The owners are absolutely awesome, the rooms are clean and fantastic, you're in the centre of the town - which is really something special and you've got a free BBQ area and fantastically clear river to swim in, just 200m away.  We've been to many places but this spot is really awesome!

name: Fornos de Algodres, praia fluvial
description: Quiet place along river. Swimming protected zone, table and BBQ, with running water. Little bar for beer, coffees and sandwiches.

name: Armin
description:
A very nice and peaceful campsite with beach access, down at the beach there is a small restaurant.
All vehicles are allowed and plenty of space for tents
Stunning sea views

name: Praia de sao
description: Nice beachside car park on top of the dunes. Solid for a couple of nights could have surf.

name: Orbitur Camping
description: Large site with direct beach access. Very clean facilities. Wifi only at the bar.

name: Supernova
description: Very good hostel near the Metro Trindade. You can easily walk to down town (river) in about 10 min.walk. Very clean, good ambiance and reasonable prices. A lot of space, nice terrace. We payed only 70€ for two persons for two days(!) in a shared room but with a double bed with privicy. Very clean! Nice staff. Several restaurants in the neighbourhood. Parking for motorbikes.

name: Camping Travanca
description: Camping Travanca, National Park Peneda-Gerês

name: Parking Camp
description: A small field, a few meters from Rio Vez, one of the most clean river in Europe. Good for park que car/4x4/van.

name: Soajo Parking
description: A small parking area with nice WC an water, in old village.

name: guincho beach
description: a nice place to sleep on car/campercar, parking lot near the beach

name: Alcazar
description:
Nice owner, speaks English and will let you stay for free. Safe place, busy on weekends, mostly in summer time. 
Free wifi and free usage of washrooms. Just ask the owner to spend the night. Quite place. Enjoy

name: Rio S. Jorge
description: Nice place, Near a river... With table lunch. Very green and quiet. Very good Spot for overlanding

name: Campismo Fuseta
description:
Rustic Municipal site, but clean & friendly. Mainly touring Motorhomes & caravans /tents, with just a few permanent. Stone pitches under mature trees, varying shade. Shower & washing facilities basic, but being updated (Oct 16). 
Part of the Ria Formosa nature reserve with fabulous beaches & islands nearby, reachable by ferry (except low season) and water taxi. Fuseta isn't touristy, but has plenty of cafés & fish restaurants. 
Secure enough to consider leaving your unit here to fly home from Faro Airport, reachable by train/bus or taxi.

name: Camping Lamas de Mouro
description: Mountain Camping, with trekking, 4x4 and canyoning  guides

name: GPL autogas.
description:
Had adapter for acme 1 ¾ connector to French dish. Very friendly. Pump uses French dish. 
Does not fill, grey, german propane-bottles.

name: Parque Campismo Baranca
description: Campground with good facilities and very good internet. Open all year. Friendly owner. With own river.

name: Ermida Geres Camping, Ermida
description: Nice little camping. Family run. Open all year (it's Christmas Day today and it rains cats and dogs). Small restaurant/bar. Good wifi. Hot shower.

name: Parking Lot Santuario, Fatima
description: Parking Lot of Santuario Fatima, there are some designated places for campers, but not enough. We stayed just next to the sanitary bloc.

name: Parque Campismo Baia Azul, San Matinho do Porto
description: Nice and cheap campground. Helpful staff, clean facilities incl laundry. Very good location just outside the village, nice beach across the street. EUR 9 for 2 incl elec in offseason. Open allyear.

name: Camping Peniche Praia, Peniche
description: The place went through a lot of construction work and most of it is finished. So everything is pretty new, clean, well organized and the staff is very friendly. We enjoyed our stay here (Old text: Old and unorganised 2star camping. The location at the cliff is less nice than expected. But really good hot shower! Ok for an overnight. Open all year.)

name: Camping Zambujeira do Mar
description: Nice little camping under eucalyptus trees. Good and clean infrastructure, very well mentained, even warm water to wash dishes. Bar open till late, small shop. Open all year.

name: quartz museum
description: Great place to park for the night and free entrance to the nice quartz museum. There is plenty space and toilets in museum. Nice view of the city and almost no noise at night.

name: Camping Orbiture, Sagres
description: Nice campground with good facilities. A bit outside of Sagres but nice view over the town. Restaurant/Bar open till 9pm. Bread can be ordered at reception. Open all year. Around 16 EUR for 2 incl. elec.

name: Vale da Carrasqueira, Monchique
description: Very nice trailer park with toilett, shower, good wifi and little pool. EUR 12.50 incl power. Popular among the huge white ships, but anyway recomendable.

name: Orbitur Camping Évora
description:
Camping with all facilities. Outside of the city. EUR 16.60 for 2 incl. elec. Ok, but nothing special. 

follow the signs to the Campground. the Garmin way is wrong.

name: Free parking close to the center
description: Free parking close to the center. Probably you can also stay there for a night.

name: Bakery - Padaria Central
description: Local bakery with good food and cheap prices.

name: Surfers' place
description: Good place for wild camping in a surfers' company. Usually a lot of campers parked here.

name: coimbra Campground
description:
Safe place and super confortable.
shower,water,electricity,huge barbecue areas,and only 10€ per tent and motorbike

name: VintageCamperVans/MtbAlgarve
description:
all vehicles are kept in a safe and covered place 
it is possible to connect the electricity
fill up the water reservoirs

Vehicles accepted Trucks caravans jeeps motorbikes
Order To info@vintagecampersvans.com

name: Parque Campismo Municipal
description: big campsite,  good and clean ablutions,  Wifi is fast  at the reception area, many trees, nice staff,e paid 10,60€ for 2 persons, a mobilehomes and electricity.

name: A Padaria Portuguesa
description: Great authentic portuguese, well priced restaurant. Good healthy Portuguese food for €5 - €8.

name: Barragem dos Patudos
description: A lake with several places to park. quiet and clean. there are water and a litle coffeshop.

name: Metalurgica do Fundão
description: Mechanical electro repairs and paint  on all vehicles

name: Jardim Oudinot Parking Lot
description: Parking lot by the lagoon for campers and caravans, safe to spend the night. View of the lagoon and fishing boats passing by. Recreational park with toilets and fishing ship museum nearby.

name: Barra RV Park
description: Free Parking Lot for campers and caravans. Safe to spend the night. View of the lagoon and fishing boats passing by. Sidewalk by the lagoon to the beach and lighthouse. Might be full on summer peak.

name: Costa Nova beach access
description: Beach access parking lot. View of the dunes. Might be crowded in the summer peaks.

name: Praia da Vagueira RV Parking
description: Camper van parking with beach access and a water tap nearby. Further down the beach there are showers and toilets. A nice beach village. A good surfing beach with rental nearby if that's your thing

name: Areão Beach Parking lot
description: Beach access parking lot, safe to spend the night, toilet facilities in the summer time.

name: Poço da Cruz Beach Parking Lot
description: Beach access parking lot, safe to spend the night, toilets in the summer time.

name: Praia de Mira beach parking lot
description: Beach access parking lot, safe to spend the night, lagoon view, near the lagoons and the village. Toilet facilities in the summer time. Cycling path across the road.

name: Praia de Quiaios beach parking lot
description: Beach access parking lot. Safe to spent the night. View of the dunes.

name: RV Parking Figueira da Foz
description:
RV parking for campers and caravans, machine paying during the day and free at night. Sea, beach and city views, fishing boats passing, beach access. City center and close to everything.
Safe to spend the night but might be noisy, sometimes there is a carnival fair next to it. 
Water and dump station on site.

name: RV Parking Figueira da Foz
description: Free water and dump station, parking lot machine paying during the day free at night.

name: Cabo do Mondego parking places
description: Free parking places by the beach side, there are many parking places around this area good for an overnight stay. Sea views and beach access.

name: unnamed place.
description: on the Tage riverside near big bridge. quiet in night

name: barrage do roxo
description: Big place near a lake. Very quiet and few camping cars here. For people who like silence.

name: Praia do Palheirão beach access
description:
Hidden gem, remote wild beach access with parking lot. Usually deserted beach, nudist area, really wild and beautiful beach, in the summer time and weekends there's a few people attending the beach. 
Only for 4x4 off road cars, the roads to this beach are in a poor state.
May not be safe if you're alone or leave the car unattended too long, good for groups stays.

name: Praia da Costinha beach access
description:
Remote wild beach access parking, really nice and usually deserted beach.
Only for 4x4 off road cars, the roads to this beach are in a poor state.
May not be safe if you're alone or leave the car unattended for too long.

name: Lagoa de Mira parking lot
description: Lagoon side small parking lot, lagoon views, with cycling path surrounding the lagoon and to the beach (5km). Good and safe for an overnight stay for small cars. Not safe for swimming or fishing, sewage connected.

name: Praia Fluvial dos Olhos da Fervença parking
description: Fresh water springs river beach parking lot, small parking lot of a river beach park. Nice clear water swimming lagoon and grass space, natural water springs.  Free water, toilets and showers on the park. Good and safe place for an overnight stay.

name: Parque de Merendas do Seixo de Mira
description: Road side parking (dead end road) at a picnic park. Nice leisure area usually empty, lots of picnic tables, barbecue places, exercise machines, children play area. Good and safe for an overnight stay. Toilets and water available.

name: Aveiro RV parking lot
description:
Free RV parking lot in Aveiro, near the city center and the canals, good for city visits.
Might be noisy to sleep, there is an highway above it.

name: Praia da Tocha parking lot
description: Free parking lot in the village center, a short walk to the beach. Safe to spend the night. Might be hard for tall cars to find a place in the summer because of the car shades they put in the summer time.

name: Parque de Merendas das Berlengas da Tocha
description: Picnic park roadside parking lot, picnic tables and barbecues around. Cycling path to the beach. Safe to spend the night but might be noisy because is roadside.

name: Water fountain
description: Free fresh tap water fountain, close to parking lot.

name: Vagueira picnic park
description: Picnic park in a forest area, lots of picnic tables around. Dirt access. Safe to spend the night.

name: Waterpark Vagueira
description:
Paying dump station, possible to stay overnight (paying). Beach and waterpark access.

http://www.vagasplash.pt/

name: Waterpark Vagueira
description:
Paying water available, possible to spend the night(paying). Beach and waterpark access.

http://www.vagasplash.pt/

name: Serra da Boa Viagem Miradouro da Bandeira
description: Top of the hill sightseeing small parking place, good for 1 night stay. Amazing view of the sea, beachs and forest below. There are a few dirty roads close by good for overnight parking and picnic places.

name: Cabedelo beach parking
description:
Cabedelo beach dirt parking, popular for surfers, great surfing spot,right on the beach, beach and sea views. Bar and camping place close.
There are other parking places close to the beach and water in this area.

name: Praia do Hospital Gala
description: Free beach access parking. Right on the beach, good for overnight stay.

name: Praia da Cova da Gala parking
description: Beach access parking lot, right on the beach. Safe to spend the night.

name: Praia da Cova da Gala parking
description: Beach access parking lot, right on the beach, beach and sea views. Safe to spend the night.

name: Parque de Merendas da Cova da Gala
description: Roadside parking in picnic park, lots of picnic tables and barbecues around, grass park, children play area. Good for overnight stays.

name: Praia de São Jacinto parking
description: Beach access parking lot, toilets available, next to a natural reserve. Safe to spend the night. Ferry boat connecting São Jacinto to Aveiro.

name: Ria de Aveiro São Jacinto
description: Roadside dirt parking on the lagoon, lagoon views, next to the natural reserve entrance, hiking paths, bird watching.

name: Ria de Aveiro São Jacinto
description: Roadside dirt parking on the lagoon, lagoon views, next to a lagoon beach, next to the natural reserve entrance, nature walking paths, bird watching.

name: Praia da Torreira parking lot
description: Beach access parking lot, cycling path. Safe to spend the night.

name: Praia de Cortegaça parking
description: Dirt parking place right on the water, sea and beach views, village center. Safe to spend the night.

name: Praia do Senhor da Pedra
description: Small parking space, beach access, rock on the sea church access, village center. Safe to spend the night. Might be full on summer peaks.

name: Vila Nova de Gaia sea parking
description: Small parking place for small cars on a dead end road, right on the water, sea, beach and city views. Might be full and difficult to access on summer peaks

name: Vila Nova de Gaia parking
description: Small parking lot next to the sea and beach. Sea views, close to the city. Might be hard to find a parking place in the summer peaks.

name: Praia do Aterro parking lot
description: Beach access large parking lot, sea and beach views, next to lighthouse. Might be full on summer peaks, there are many parking places around this area.

name: Praia de Mira sul
description:
Wild beach access, dirt road and parking. Next to a gay nudist beach, and traditional fishing boat area. Busier on weekends and summer time, quiet at night.
Only for 4x4 off road cars, the road to this beach is in poor state.

name: Intermarché Mira RV parking
description: Supermarket parking lot that allows overnight stays for RVs. Self service laundry machines in the parking lot, and gas station.

name: Intermaché Mira
description: Self service laundry machines in the parking lot. RVs overnight stays allowed.

name: Tocha parking
description: Village center parking lot. Parking not allowed on market days(ususally saturdays), if you see vans arriving during the night or early hours you will have to leave. Safe place for an overnight stay when travelling, but close to a busy road.

name: Ançã water fountain
description: Free fresh water fountain, roadside parking across the road.

name: Luso water fountain
description: Free natural spings water, very good quality water. Parking next to the fountain.

name: Furadouro RV parking
description: Free RV parking lot, close to the beach and village. Safe to spend the night.

name: Costa Nova lagoon parking
description: Lagoon side parking, lagoon views, quiet and safe area, rod fishing place, cycling path, outdoor exercise machine. Close to a lagoon beach, close to Costa Nova beach and Village. Not suitable for big rigs.

name: Costa Nova parking
description: Roadside free parking, close to the beach, lagoon views, recreational park, village center. Many rvs stay here overnight, safe to spend the night, roadside noise.

name: Vagos parking lot
description: City center parking lot, river views, recreational park. Safe to spend the night.

name: Lagoa da Vela
description: Lagoon access dirt road. You can park right beside the lagoon, lagoon view, children playground. Picnic park with picnic tables and barbecue nearby. Safe to spend the night. 2017 forest fires destroyed the trees and the landscape a bit but still nice lagoon views

name: Supermarket parking lot Figueira da Foz
description: Supermarket parking lot, next to macdonald's restaurant, garden and children playground. Safe to spend the night, there are many parking spaces around this area good for an overnight stay.

name: Mira parking lot
description: Parking lot next to N109 road, good for an overnight stay when traveling. Next to a garden, toilets nearby, children playground, village center, restaurants, post office, other services. Safe to spend the night.

name: Ilhavo parking
description: City center roadside parking, next to a parking lot(big cars and trucks not allowed inside parking lot). Close to Maritime museum/Aquarium and Vista Alegre museum. Safe for an overnight stay.

name: Ilhavo Maritime museum parking
description: Maritime museum and aquarium parking lot. Safe for an overnight stay. Close to city center and services.

name: Costa Nova RV parking
description: Free RV parking, next to the beach, dunes view, toilets(summer time). Safe to spend the night.

name: Figueira da Foz commercial harbor parking
description: Large dirt space in the commercial harbor, next to the water. Nice views of water, harbor, bridge and city. Fishing spot.

name: Praia do Osso da Baleia parking lot
description: Remote beach access large gravel parking lot, really nice wild beach. Might not be safe if you're alone. Cycling path. Bar open in the summer time. Good paved access.

name: Praia do Pedrógão parking lot
description: Free parking lot right on the sea front, beach access, sea views, village center, restaurants. Might be full in the peak of summer.

name: Praia da Vieira de leiria parking lot
description: Large free parking lot for campers and caravans, close to the beach, river view, cycling path.

name: São Pedro de Moel parking
description: Top of the hill free parking lot, nice views, close to the beach, village center. Might be full in the summer peak. Safe to spend the night. There is another parking lot down the road.

name: Praia da Polvoeira beach access
description: Dirt road beach access, beautiful wild beach, nice sea and beach views. The road is very inclined but there is a more leveled area in the entrance.

name: Praia Paredes da Vitória parking lot
description: Top of the hill free parking lot, inclined parking lot, sea and beach views, beach access.

name: Quinta da Falca station
description: Private restaurant sanitation station.  Water + dump station = 3Euros

name: Quinta da Falca RV park
description:
Private restaurant RV park. Beach access.

Camper (24H) + Water + Dump station = 10 Euros

name: Espinho parking lot
description: Large free parking lot, beach access, close to a supermarket and city center.

name: Espinho roadside parking lot
description:
Roadside large free parking lot, beach access, sea view. Cycling path across the road. Safe to spend the night.
There's a similar parking lot down the road closer to Espinho center.

name: Albergue peregrinos a recoleta
description:
Nice hostel, the guy on front desk spoke good English!
Open from 14:00-21:00.
Only €5 if you have a Pilgrim passport (which you can get for €2 at most pilgrim hostels)

name: Praia da Aguda
description: Parking lot and a few sandy street bays along the unpaved road southwards. Beach access and sea view from the cliffs.

name: Praia de Assentiz
description:
Very nice spot with an awesome view of the ocean and light house.
Put the tent for the night, ok.
Access by a little track, ok for 2wd car but drive slowly.
The beach is 1/2h away, but a stiff track, bit worth it. Absolutely beautiful!

According to the Highway Code in articles 48 and 50-A, it states: Overnight stays are allowed up to a maximum of 48 hours in the same municipality and are prohibited in areas of the Natura 2000 network and protected areas. Overnight stays between 21:00 and 7:00 are allowed.

name: Praia de Rei, Cortico, Obidos
description:
Parking lot near beach bar, clean, toilets during daytime, sunset view. We stayed there end of July and only three cars during the night. Very quiet. 
Nice beach bar. Small and simple.

name: Parking lot surf beach Ericeira
description:
Only the passage of 2,20m height is allowed.

Parking lot overlooking surf beach on the south side of Ericeira.  Quiet. No facilities. You share the spot with other vans/campers. View is second to none.  A bar with toilets available during the day

name: Praia do Andraga
description: Parking lot next to the beach. During daytime you pay 1.5 euro, free after 19.00 hours & off season.  Restaurant, showers and public toilets during the day. Nice beach.

name: Ecoparque do Outão
description: Nice clean campsite along the bay. Clean hot showers. Very friendly staff and guards. Dogs welcome. 9,40 for 1 minivan up to 6 persons.

name: Praia das Maçãs
description: Quiet place to spend the day and sleep at night, with panoramic views of the sea and a beautiful sunset

name: Parking Lidl
description:
Lidl has a special section for campers on the parking lot. You can stay overnight. 
Quiet village. No facilities when Lidl is closed.

name: Vila Nova de Milfontes
description: Complete and nice camping with swimming pool, hot showers, restaurant and 800 meters of sea.

name: Praia do Rodanho
description: Parking spot, but nice to stay for a few days, beach nearby, other campervans around, no facilities

name: Praia da Figueirinha
description: Autocaravan Park, side by side with beach

name: Boca do Inferno, Cascais
description: Great place to spend the night, with paid bathroom, snack bar, restaurant, tourist spot and sea view.

name: Parque de Campismo Rossio de Valhelhas
description:
Joli camping au bord du rio Zezere avec une petite plage fluviale attenante. Ombragé, station d'eau et de vidange pour camping-car, électricité possible, sanitaires propres, petit bar/restaurant. Ambiance familiale.

Nice campsite on the rio Zezere with a small adjoining river beach. Shaded, water and dumping station for camper, electricity at site, clean toilets, small bar / restaurant. Family atmosphere.

name: Torre
description:
Parking au sommet de Torre, point culminant du Portugal. Magasin de produits locaux vraiment intéressant à proximité. Sanitaires aux heures d'ouverture des boutiques. Calme hormis les chiens de berger qui n'ont pas appréciés notre présence.Superbe vue.

Parking at the top of Torre, highest point of Portugal. Local produce store really interesting nearby. Sanitary at the opening hours of shops. Quiet except the sheepdogs who did not appreciate our presence. Great view.

name: Camping Alentejo
description:
Agréable camping à quelques kilomètres d'Evora. Petite piscine. Sanitaires magnifiques. Peu d'ombre. Route proche très passante même de nuit. Dommage. Wifi.

Pleasant campsite a few kilometers from Evora. Small pool. Beautiful sanitary . Little shade. Close road very busy even at night. Wifi on site.

name: Parque De Pernoita De Autocaravanas Monsaraz
description:
Parking au pied des murailles. Très chaud en été. Peu d'ombre. Pas de services. Superbe vue et pratique pour visiter la ville.

Parking at the bottom of the walls. Very hot in summer. Little shade. No services. Great view and convenient to visit the city.

name: Parque De Campismo E Caravanismo Do Sindicato Dos Bancários Do Sul E Ilhas Olhao
description: Superbe camping sous les pins. Grande piscine à payer en supplément. Sanitaires propres et en grand nombre. Eau potable et vidange. Electricité possible.

name: Parking Fortaleza Sagres
description:
Parking de la forteresse de Sagres. Très calme mais sans services. Accès possible à une petite plage.

Parking of the fortress of Sagres. Very calm but without services. Possible access to a small beach.

name: Praia Samoqueira Porto Covo
description:
Parking en bord de mer juste au dessus des falaises. Vue splendide et jolie plage. Pas de services.

Parking by the sea just above the cliffs. Splendid view and pretty beach. No services.

name: Parque Municipal de Campismo Tomar
description:
Camping un peu vieillot mais proche du centre ville et de la grande piscine municipale. Sanitaires un peu ancien mais propre.

Camping a little bit old but close to the city center and the large municipal pool. Sanitary a bit old too but clean.

name: Parking Ruinas de Conimbriga
description:
Parking du site des ruines de Conimbriga. Sanitaires accessibles aux heures d'ouverture. Tranquille la nuit.

Parking site of the ruins of Conimbriga. Sanitary facilities available during opening hours. Quiet at night.

name: Ponte de Lima
description:
Large parking area on the banks of the Lima River. Close to the city. Quiet enough at night. No services.
.....
Grand parking au bord du fleuve Lima. A deux pas de la ville. Assez calme la nuit. Pas de services.

name: Camping Penha Guimaraes
description:
Camping sur la colline surplombant Guimaraes. Bondé en août lors du festival de Festas Gualterianas. Sanitaires insuffisants en nombre. Minuscule piscine. Joli cadre et jolie vue. Accès facile à Guimaraes en funiculaire.

Camping on the hill overlooking Guimaraes. Crowded in August at the festival of Festas Gualterianas. Sanitary insufficient in number. Tiny pool. Nice setting and nice view. Easy access to Guimaraes by funicular.

name: Parque de Autocaravanas Braganca
description:
Aire pour camping-car avec eau et vidange au pied du château des ducs de Bragance. Plein à notre arrivée, nous avons dormi dans une rue adjacente.

Motorhome area with water and dumping at the bottom of the castle of the Dukes of Braganza. Full when we arrived, we slept in an adjacent street.

name: near serra de estrela
description: gravel parking lot away from the roadside with mountain views

name: Ria Formosa camping site - Conceição Cabanas Tavira
description: First class site with all amenities incl laundry , pool restaurant - all well run !

name: Praia das Furnas
description: Parking space at the Furnas beach. Popular with surfers. Room for 20+ campers if packed. Not as busy as Milfontes parkings.

name: Praça de Touros
description: parking with more than 150 parking spaces paved and shaded by trees

name: Amieira
description:
Nice and calm spot, with very nice views and close to the water.
No facilities of any kind.
Without shadows and with sharp slope.

name: Parking lot on the river
description: Camper parking and hand laundry in a parking lot on the river.

name: Praia do Cabeço parking
description: Big parking space on compacted ground near the Praia do Cabeço. Surrounded by pine forrest with access to two beaches and three restaurants/bars. Sleeping in camper vans is not forbidden but accepted.

name: Praia dos Pescadores
description: Great place to sleep and spend the day by the river Tejo.

name: Sulpark-Albufeira Caravans
description:
Sulpark- Albufeira Caravans. Recently open but great place for holidays at Albufeira city in Portugal! 3km from beaches, place with the feeling of countryside! Enough space for picnics and animals, very kind owners too. washroom and showers soon being built. 
->>we also receive caravans for overnight at any time of the day. if you need a place to rest at 3am after a big trip, we can help!

name: Parlour inho
description:
This is a great little AirBnb attached/above local Pizza/Baker/Cafe
Inexpensive @ approx €15 per night. We booked on AirBnb, but then extended our stay another two nights. Very small rural village. You can cook your own food in the apartment kitchen or purchase meals at very cheap prices from the Pizza/Cafe/Restaurant
Contact owner - Mari (Tel:238748151 Email: paolourinho@sapo.pt

name: Quinta Padrela. Winery house. Overnight OK
description:
Property of 12 hectares, located in the heart of the Douro Region, considered World Heritage by UNESCO. The location reserved for motorhomes (5000 m2). Pool available when empty guest house. Free personalized visit to the museum and other points of interest in the Village (3 km from the property)

Free guided tour to the property. Free tasting of wines. Open all year. Water point. Free WIFI. Market / grocery store nearby. Barbecue allowed.

Possibility table d'hôte, dinner Friday and Saturday (reservation by e-mail: geral@quintadapadrela.com)
Attention no home possible the 2,3 4, 28 and 29 September.

name: Arganil
description: Perfect place for big rigs, Water available. Good road to accès

name: Ferry (Setúbal to Comporta)
description:
You can take a vehicle ferry here between Setúbal and Comporta
.

name: Com Cuore (sem gluten/without gluten)
description: Bakery & Cafe especially for those of you sensitive to gluten.  They have soup, desserts & pastries, drinks hot & cold, wine & beer (also, gluten free beer), sandwiches, crepes, waffles and pancakes.

name: art shops
description: One of the entrances is here for indoor shops and food spots, inside of a plaza.  They are not commercial brands, but independent and local artistans.  Also, you are in an Arts district.  Explore galleries in this neighborhood and street art.

name: Quintal Bioshop (organic/health food) Grocery
description: You will find a lot of organic and health products here.  For those of you who are gluten-free, vegetarian or vegan - you have options here.  They also have natural cosmetics.  There is also a cafe/coffeeshop in the very back.

name: Barragem
description: Very beautiful place, great view of the lake. A bit steep, but its a paved road.

name: Secret camp spot
description: Amazing place to spend the night and to explore all the beautiful views around here.

name: Farol Cabo do Sardao
description: Beautiful view, easy access, no infrastructure

name: Parque de Campismo
description: Lovely campsite at the border with Spain. Very clean with excellent facilities. 3 euros per person plus 4 euros for small camper. Electric extra.

name: Area 4x4 - Workshop and Supplies
description: Specializing in overland outfitting and repairs of 4x4s, especially Land Rover and Toyota. Importer for Front Runner, Alucab, National Luna, ARB, Old Man Emu, etc. Repaired my Td5 transfer case and gearbox. Nuno spraks excellent English. WhatsApp +351-92-600-5555

name: H2O Snack bar
description:
inexpensive restaurant (from 5 to 7 euros per main course), good and abundant dishes. unmissable French fries (real, not frozen). recommended


ristorantino economico (da 5 a 7 euro circa per piatto principale), pietanze buone e abbondanti. imperdibili le patatine fritte (vere, non surgelate). consigliato

name: sintra
description: Public drinking water faucet on a quiet side street --- rubinetto pubblico di acqua potabile su strada secondaria molto tranquilla

name: Parque de campismo Orbitur Foz de Arelho
description: Big campground that's open all year. Services like TV room or swimming pool are closed during the winter.

name: Parking lot near Batalha Monastery
description: Parking lot near Batalha Monastery. Feels safe, spent the night. Free wifi, bathrooms (were closed during the night), no other ammenities. Lots of spots.

name: V+E Torres Vedras
description: Easy dumpstation for free. Portable water and black and greywater dump.

name: the pasture
description: open space off road.  was left alone all night

name: Height restriction 3 metres ER 246 Santa Elalia
description: Height restriction railway bridge 3 metres max.

name: Free camping near boat yard
description: Packed soil located between boat yard and beach. Big open space

name: Luz, museo at lake
description: Picknic area, water tap, small playground, long jetty to the lake.

name: Cimetario Juromenha
description: Near graveyard, very quiet, beautiful view over Guadalajara river

name: Barragem Ciborro Free Camp
description: Lovely grassy spots between the gumtrees along the barragem access track from the village (follow barragem signs). Track is in good condition, no need for 4wd or clearance, but is not that wide. Perfect spots for medium sized rigs to park and (motor)bikers to pitch a tent. The valley protects good against wind. Little stream proberly dry in summer. Very quiet and dark. 3G available.

name: Great overnight parking
description: Perfect overnight stop. Safe parking next to beautiful beach.

name: eco campismo de setubal
description: wonderful.dirct at the sado river.real hot showers.for me one of most relaxing places in sothern europe.great.euro6.-

name: unknown name
description: big sandy,gras place.direct access to a nice great beach.good

name: Santa Luzia Parking Lot
description: Free parking lot at the very beginning of the beautiful village Santa Luzia. No toilettes/bathroom but there are a few restaurants/snack bars around. We found a toilette house near the harbour but it was closed, maybe open during the summer/main season.

name: Natural water source
description: Get great quality water from natural source. Locals fill up their bottles here.

name: Intermarche Budens
description: informal but officially signposted campsite next to intermarche. overnight stays probably accepted but next to en125. lovely surroundings with hills and nature.

name: Parking Povo do Baixo, Alferce
description: Europ relais dumping station with water. Free and clean (lets keep it that way!) Small village with small store and small bar. Super quiet (except for a dog or so). Room for 4 campers and next to official parking there is a dirt road where you can also park. Washing facilities with clothes lines (the old fashion way) and a public pool next door. Public bbq, super spot!! Nice views, flowers and trees..

name: Intermarche
description: Dumping at euro relais. Non-potable water; 100L for 2€. Get token at gas station next to it.

name: Praia do Bordeira
description: nice and quiet spot on public parking behind the marshes. all sorts of rigs from big to box trucks.

name: Praia de Loulé Velho
description: camping a stone throw from the sea, directly at the beach. seems to be an officially endorsed camp area. access road good but final stretch adventurous for big rigs. large box trucks should be fine. busy with locals over the weekend.

name: Top of cliffs
description: Perfect spot on top of the cliffs overlooking a small beach. Getting here nu dirt road only. 4x4 recommended. Amazing view and sound of the waves.

name: Parque de Campismo de Alcácer do Sal
description: Nice little campground in Alcacer do Sol. €8.90 for two of and a tent on our bicycles. Pitches are large and shaded and have hedges for privacy. Showers are hot and clean. Toilets are BYO toilet paper. A good spot to spend the night. Grocery store next door and Lidl across the road.

name: Toca Da Raposa
description:
Very pleasant campsite with good facilities, swimming pool, bar and an atmospheric restaurant (sitting inside or on the patio) The owner and staff are very friendly and helpful. 
There are few friendly dogs and cats (and guinea pigs!) on the campground but as far as we know your pet is welcome and apparently the resident dogs are quite chilled out and friendly with camping doggies.
When you come and stay here, make sure there's a Wednesday night for you to enjoy and experience the best (authentic) pizza dish! Baked by a fabulous Italian/Belgian couple using their home grown organic ingredients and baked in the outside wood-fired pizza oven. An absolute must and very pleasant experience! (these Wednesday Pizza night are only at season time from Easter - October) And of course there's no pizza without a nice bottle of cold beer (good selection of Belgian and Portuguese beers)
You can just turn up or call ahead: (+351)238601547 or (+351)926704218

name: Drinking water next to the road
description: Drinking water fountain next to the road. Local people stop here to fill up their drinking bottles.

name: Tourbus compartment at Ingrina Campsite
description:
Tourbus compartment or sleeping berth at campsite Ingrina near Vila do Bispo in the nature reserve.

I was here with my motorbike in May (Touring cbf 600) looking for a safe base for my luggage and my bike. It was perfect. Motorcycle parked next to bus. I stayed 3 weeks.
Had a compartment in the upper flor of "Roman's Tourbus" (ask at the gate of the Camping vor check air bnb). 1night / ~ 14, - € (depends how you book/stay) . Use of all facilities of Ingrina Camping (older campsite but its clean and  uncomplicated, reliable hot showers when I was here!). At night starry sky and Milky Way through open roof hatch in the 2-beds-compartment :-) 

  I left my havy luggage in the bus and I made several motorcycle tours through the West Algarve, Monchique Mountains and visited several beaches (often unpaved roads). 
Very quiet, in the middle of nature - beautifull beaches also on foot accessible. Roman is a friendly and helpful host.
(Pictures of bus and view from the restaurant terrace towards the Ingrina-Beach)

name: Lighthouse Camping
description:
On the opposite side of the main parking ground at the lighthouse it is possible to camp directly at the cliff.
There you have an nice view over the ocean.
It is not a really campground but perfect for one night!

name: Pomarao
description: Big parking lot by the river. No facilities, but nice view of old little mining town. Very quiet for the night. Bar in town..

name: Quiet spot on the lake
description: This spot has beautiful view over the  lake. You can't swim here because there is a dam nearby. But it's beautiful to just stay here and enjoy the tranquility. Some shade from the trees, good for hot days. Very quiet at night. No facilities.

name: This is a beauty
description: This is the place to be. Amazing spot on a small island. Great for swimming. Not many people around here even not on the weekend. Very peaceful and quiet. There is a gravel road for the last few km and the road is very narrow. Only for small vehicles. To reach the island you might need a 4x4. The last part is very steep. If you don't have a 4x4 there is another spot 500m before the island with picnic tables. also very beautiful.

name: Arrifana
description: Informal Parking Area, right after official parking, where it is not allowed to stay overnight. Perfect view over the bay.

name: Alcaçer do Sal
description: Parking with public toilet, water and cafe nearby. The city of Alcaçer with shops and restaurants is an easy walk across a foot bridge

name: Cliffs near Arrifane
description:
Nice spot on the cliffs, great sunset and view on nearby towns and cliffs with space to park 2-3 vehicles overnight. Careful if you arrive in the dark, steep drop without a fence.
Place is close to Rota Vincentina but seems to be rarely used at night.
There are remnants of a camp fire place here though you need to bring your own wood/coal and its super dry so be careful.
Access is through an unpaved road with a few rocks in it, high body clearance is helpful but 4 wheel drive is not needed. Access road is even on Google maps.

name: Forte de Almadena
description:
Parking lot next to an old fort. A few vans parked there every night and seems to be tolerated by the locals. Please respect nature & visitors to the fort during the day.

Access through an unpaved road but unproblematic for all vehicles.

Decent view in the morning if you park in the right spot or walk a few steps and you find yourself on the cliffs :-)

name: Dirt road around lake
description: Room for one vehicle overlooking the lake. Great for a van or C-class RV. Secluded and beautiful spot.

name: Parque de Campo Municipal
description:
Established Campsite
Big campsite, hardly any people in June. English speaking and very friendly in reception. 
Spotless toilet block.
Some of the lowest prices in europe. Cost €5.75 for one person, a car and a tent. No other facilities and ideally need transport back up the road to town.

name: Café Rio Coa
description: Very nice campsite right next to the river. Friendly and helpful owner! Possibility to rent a canoe for small money, take a beer or coffee in the café or just step out of your car/tent in the morning and take a bath in the clear water. Perfect place to stay!

name: Murça mountain bike trails
description: Mountain biking trail system near Murça with a vast network of fire roads and areas along side them to park a vehicle or pitch a tent. The section of road we drove required no 4x4 or off-road capabilities. The area has been extremely quite over the day that we have been here, we haven't encountered anyone else. However I cannot say this for all year round as there seems to be a mountain biking event on at some stage in the year (most likely winter due to the hot summers). We parked at the crest of a hill and pitched a tent on a flat area away from the nearest main road

name: Camping Pião
description: Nice camping, right near "Serra da Estrela", the highest mountain in Portugal.

name: Goiscamp
description: A nice camp with some amenities right next to the center of the village. It has a river with sand where you can bath. Just great!

name: Praia do Pinheirinho
description: One of the very best campsites we found in Portugal. Place is definitely open. There are some fence works going on along the access road but only along the sides of the road. A big work truck was blocking the way, but as soon as we pulled up the workers came over and moved it for us and were very friendly. To get to the actual campsite you 100% need 4x4, good tires and good sand driving skills and confidence. Lots of deep sand that will swallow you if you are not careful. Once you get there it is a paradise all to yourself. Pristine sand beaches and great surf

name: Boliqueime C.M.Pedro Auto Crew
description: They fill German propane-bottles (the grey ones) and sell adapter.

name: Sobredo
description: Nice clean quiet spot, and a great view. Flat area for parking/camping, no people around - only nature. Access for smaller 4w drive only, ideal overlanders with rooftent.

name: Time to Wash
description: Great laundromat with free / fast WiFi! 5 for a wash and 1.50 for 15 minutes of drying. Aldi is just down the street so you can shop while you wash.

name: Lakeside Boondocking
description: Several pull-outs next to a peaceful lake. No facilities. Very quiet overnight.

name: Farmacia Fermentelos
description: Great Pharmacy with very helpful, English-speaking pharmacist. Right next to a great coffee shop/bakery with good WiFi.

name: Cachopo / Tavira road
description: Parking  area in the hills with picnic tables and non p water , slight slope but very quiet , unofficial overnight aire ! Very picturesque with birdsong , herbs  and amazing views !

name: Capela de N. Sra. do Calvelo
description: Lots of possibilities for parking, also overnight. There are toilets and sinks (you need a key; the man who took the fireguard opened it for us). Great views southwards.

name: Dino footprints
description: We were looking at night for a place to stay and landed here. Very quiet, no wind!!! And there is almost no one at this tourist attraction. We could park and sleep here without a problem. Not very nice no facilities, but safe to stay a night.

name: Parking lot of beach galapinhos
description: You can leave your car here the whole day. It costs 4 euros and you can stay till next morning at 8 o clock with that ticket. No facilities but good entrance to several beaches. There is shuttle bus to all the beaches which leaves every 15 min till 20 p.m. or you can take a quick hike to a local praia without tourists. At day it is very full, but almost no one at night.

name: forêt
description:
Spot penard easy access, road passable by car.
-----
spot pénard facile d'accès, chemin praticable en voiture.

name: Pereiro parque de merendas y autocaravanismo
description: Large hardstanding parking with dumping facilities plus WC and sinks, bbqs. On the edge of a small town and next to a lagoon that I assume is much fuller in the spring (we are here in September). overflow parking on the adjoining field. Great facility although I imagine a little desolate feeling if there were no other vans here. Big skies.

name: Spring water
description: 50m off the road on the dirt path is free spring water.

name: potable water
description: Public water tap. Possible to drive close with your car so you can feel up a water tank. Locals said it is good to drink without boiling.

name: Rural
description: Basic camp site  with warm shower and toilets. The gate is closed but you can open it yourself . There are two frendly dogs - they guide you to the site.

name: Arco Natural
description: Few small camping spots. Only accessible by 4x4. Busy during daytime by people walking to the natural arch. Nice seaview.

name: Albergue Casa do Sardão
description:
Hostel with parking place.
You can use kitchen, showers and bathrooms, and all the common areas.

name: My Guest House
description: Nice hostel, spacious and clean. 15€ for a dorm bed. Small pool, nice outdoor & common area, even a BBQ! Plenty of street parking for cars, motorcycles and bicycles can be parked in the gated area at the front.

name: River
description: Nice spot for a night sleeping near river. Only 4x4

name: Barragem dos Gagos
description: Nice spot with sunshade and water to fish. It's in a hunting area, so stay in the open and visible.

name: Lagoa do Saloio
description: Nice place with some tables and by a lake.

name: Interpretive Center
description:
Excellent interpetive panels 24/7 about menirs, megaliths, montado landscape, cork production, prehistory, flora and fauna, cork and holm oaks.
small shop and toilets nearby.

name: Quinta De Reciao
description: Lovely spot on the river. Old Grist mill. Great roads to ride. Don’t try to get here in the dark. Crazy. Have food with you when you come. Full kitchen and nothing to eat for miles around. Worth the stop. Book online

name: Sao Domingos
description: A very nice place. At the lake side. Good for swimming.  A bit diffucult to reach. Worth the effort.

name: Parque de campismo de Mogadouro
description: Nice campsite, hot showers 11€ for 2 motorcycles and 1 tent. No restaurant but there’s a supermarket 2 kilometres away.

name: Campimeco
description:
This Campsite is found inside the beautiful region of Sesimbra, where there is a whole historical and fishing tradition. It is also near the beach “Praia das Bicas”, in the Meco Village, one of the most sought beaches on the western coast. People come here to practice several sports (surf, bodyboard) and also to find cliffs filled with fossils.
It possesses a total area of 220.000m2 (meters) and it is surrounded by an area of great natural beauty, between the green of the dense pine tree forests and the blue of the ocean. It is the perfect place for nature lovers to enjoy the tranquility of the countryside as well as the rebellion of the ocean.

name: Near Torres
description: Small flat place next to gravelroad, quiet, nice sunrise. Not for big RVs, but Toyota, Defender...

name: Viewpoint Albufeira de Barragem do Arade
description: Beautiful viewpoint over the lake. Quiet, just some locals passing by by car. I slept here for one night together with my dog in our rooftoptent. No toilet, shower, water.

name: Residencia Borsalino
description: This small residence is well located 1,5 km away from the center. Has a great price tag clean rooms and good safe parking on the back for the vehicle. It is an old traditional house converted to a home stay like accommodation.

name: Senhor das Almas
description: free, 48 h motor home parking , 6 parking lots, very nice church bells sound

name: Senhor das Almas
description: Dumpstation on the free motor home parking

name: Praia de São Julião
description: a big gravel parking place, near to the beach, quiet at night

name: Águas de Moura
description: big motorhome overnight parking place with water and dumpstation, free

name: Picnic Place
description: very nice picnic place with clean toilets and water

name: Wild beautiful parking
description: Extremely beautiful spot on a cliff, space for 1 campervan , 2 max , sea view

name: Praia da Foz
description: Parking lot of little known beach. Trash bins on site. Great sunsets.

name: Bifanas & Co.
description: Really good local restaurant with lots of tables. Varied menu with vegetarian options and a Menu of the Day for €7.50 3 courses, wine and coffee). Highly recommended if you're nearby.

name: alamal river club
description: The Alamal River club has some grounds where you can camp for free. if you'll stay more than 1 night you need a permit from the government. you have everything you need, even WiFi.

name: Cafe Cruzeiro/AirBNB
description:
Nice rooms above the Cafe Cruzeiro. Ask for the rooms in the cafe or book on AirBNB. 17-22€ depending on weekday/season. There’s also a kitchen if you want to cook yourself. And secure parking behind a gate.
There is a nice hike to a waterfall nearby.

name: Porto Spot Hostel
description:
Modern hostel, good beds. Breakfast and tourist tax included for 16€ in a 4 bed dorm.
Cheap dinner (pay as much as you want, 5-8€ recommended).
Motorcycle parking possible for 1-2, but it’s narrow and a bit steep (see photos).

name: alpedrinha farm
description:
Superb quiet location, aloe vera farm, run by very friendly Dutch people. Arrive by the north and not by the small roads / paths of the south, because they are impassable for a cc but OK for van or 4x4. 10 € per night with sanitary and hot showers, 2.50 for electricity. About 80 locations only open for 12-18 months. Share

Superbe endroit au calme, ferme d'aloe vera, tenue par des Hollandais très sympathique. Arrivez par le nord et non pas par les petites routes/sentiers du sud, car elles sont impraticables pour un cc mais OK pour fourgonnette ou 4x4. 10€ la nuit avec sanitaire et douches chaudes, 2,50 pour l'électricité. Environ 80 emplacements seulement ouvert depuis 12-18 mois. Partagez

name: Nazare Hostel
description:
Nice cozy hostel! 14€ in a 4 bed dorm. Good wifi, kitchen, nice view over the town. Parking in front of the hostel in a quiet part of the town (it’s a dead end).
Close to the beach and the ‘elevador’ up to the cliffs.

name: Moon Hill Hostel
description: Modern and new hostel, plenty of space to hang out. Bar and restaurant (but only open in high season). Kitchen, TV, fast WiFi. Breakfast included. Safe motorcycle parking for about 3-4 bikes. It’s rather expensive at 21€.

name: Mercedes mechanic - solid work
description:
Mercedes and other German brands mechanic bit expensive on the parts, but solid guys, good knowledge and very helpful. 
Ask for Vitor, he speaks English. Other guys also a bit.

name: I Ka Hale
description:
Part hotel, part hostel, part informal camping spot.
I rented a room here and it was great. Cheap too €15.
the owner also said ppl have set up their motorhomes in the big yard and paid a small fee to use the facilities.
big place, hot showers, plenty of space to hang out.
Come and camp, hotel or hostel it.
Great spot for surfing

name: Parque de campismo da Albufeira do Maranhão
description: Nice place with camping, swimming pool, restaurant and boat rump. People can also park Camping cars outside.

name: Parque de Merendas, Barragem de Póvoa e Meadas
description: Nice place to park, next to the dam, accessible for bathing. It has a picnic area and a public grill, with sink and running water. It is possible to park and spend the night, calm, quiet and safe. Camping is prohibited. --- Local agradável para parquear, junto à barragem, acessível para banhos. Tem um parque de merendas e um grelhados público, com lava-loiças e água corrente. É possível estacionar e passar a noite, calmo tranquilo e seguro. É proibido acampar.

name: Parque de merendas fonte do Touril
description: A picnic area, with a BBQ and water fountain. Quiet in the middle of nowhere. Nice to stay for the night.

name: Cheapest car parts in town
description:
Friend of mine brought me here to get spare parts. You cannot find a cheaper place in Porto and they do have all the parts for all the brands.

If you heading to Africa - this is the place to stock up on filters and other spare parts. 

Sacramento & Gouveia 
*Peças para automóveis*

name: GASPROCAR - gas bottle filling
description:
Gas station - fill any type of gas bottle, they even have different adaptors to fit your gas bottle. 
You can also purchase some adaptors, 16E each.

name: ribeira do vascao
description:
wild place , quiet. fine for 2 ou 3 day, 
dirt path to the spoot
in summer it is possible not to have water on the river

name: Free Place to Camp
description: Along a river, nice spot to camp, by car/suv/Truck reach able

name: CLEAN TAP WATER
description: Super free tap water! 2 bigs taps next to the street! you also got rubbish bins ans free clean toilets (no shower) in front!! useful!!:)

name: quedas de água Ribeira do Sampaio
description: Quedas de água ribeira do Sampaio it is a beautiful waterfall. You just need to walk 1km to see this beautiful place

name: Ereira
description:
Great, big camping area offered for free by the (very small) community. No reception, no registration, just enjoy. With shade (!), Boules game court (jeu de boules), football area, tennis court, BBQ spot, benches, water taps, toilets and (open) showers. Directly next to a nice artificial lake were you can have a nice swim. Very quiet, especially during the night, no barking dogs !

Just 10 min by foot to the (only) cafe (best hamburger and pastels de bacalhau, wifi) in the centre and 15 min to the (only) restaurant (with weekdays menus at €7.50) and a la carte in the weekends (€10 to €15). Multibanco atm and two small groceries are also available. 

One drawback : Eriera is famous for it's rice fields. That means huge areas of water. With beautiful storches and with musquitos. They attack from sunset for some 2 to 3 hours. But you can sit at the other side of the waterpool, and in the cafe  ;)

Simple but/so recommended !

name: Cromeleque dos Almendres
description: Parking of the Cromeleque dos Almendres. If you stay here over night you can watch this incredible menhir circle by sunset and sunrise alone. A highlight of our Portugal trip.

name: Surf & Nature Salema eco Camp
description: Huge beautiful Camp site with hills and trees, showers, toilets, drinking water, electricity, a shop and a very good restaurant. Paid between 13,50 and 18 euros (price changed with a new month) a night for a tent, a motorbike and one person. Wifi only at the reception and the restaurant.

name: free clean water
description: Free clean water near the church senhora dos remedios

name: River side
description: Convenient place to camp close to Porto. Ideal to go visit the city the next day.

name: waterfall cascata da cabreia
description:
Wonderful place to spend a full day, picnic or even just to enjoy the Bom River.

Maravilhoso lugar para passar um dia inteiro, piquenique ou mesmo só para desfrutar do rio Bom.

name: Pçadissos do Paiva
description: the award for Best Adventure Tourism Attraction in the World. The World Travel Awards, known as the Oscars of tourism, have already recognized this incredible route in Portugal several times. The longest pedestrian suspension bridge in the world

name: parking
description: parking during day, close to the road, but close to the beach.

name: supermarket
description: park at a supermarket place, quiet, with a supermarket just at 10m, atm, perfect because tomorrow i go with the kids at slide and splash park

name: close to the beach
description: big camp, perfect for night, and day to visit albufeira

name: beja fluvial beach
description: just a park, in muddle of olive trees, quiet and nautical base at 500m

name: Municipal campsite of Idanha-a-Nova
description:
Has camping area, trailer area and bungalows. Big enough to have quite areas, within walking distance to a lake (dam reservoir) and has shades.
1 person + 1 tent + 1 motorcycle about 7.5€/night during high season.
[restaurant/bar/minimarket closed due to COVID]

name: Campismo Torreira
description: Very basic campsite. Cheap prices (4€ per person and per tent).

name: Perfect Camping at River - wild
description: Good Spot for a Night close to river. Has tables made out of rocks. Some fisherman around. Besides it was quite. Awesome stars too...

name: River Beach Paul Praia Natural do Paul
description: Very nice beach in the river. There is no bathroom. Only a small bar.

name: camping o moinho
description: Camping with green area. Hot shower between 18-23h. Very close to a river beach

name: Parking Praia Grande
description: Great overnight (tolerated), modern parking with nice sea view. Public toilets and cold beach showers 10min walking at the beach.

name: Water pump
description: Water (non drinking) station and disposables. There is a tap for potable and non-potable water.

name: Boxmot - good Mechanic for motorbikes
description: Nice little workshop. Alberto is a very experienced mechanic. Specialist for BMW and Kawasaki, but he told me he can just fix everything. ;-) He has all diagnostic tools. Changed my tires - call them first to make an appointment.

name: fonte Paulo Luís martins
description: Free clean water in a source. Near to covão dametade.

name: fragas de São Simão
description: Nice river beach with pools, there is a bar with a good food. Fast food like burgers.

name: Cascata de água d'alta
description: Waterfall near the road with parking. There is free water source.

name: Passadiços do orvalho
description: Free water and clean source. There is a waterfall near to visit.

name: Water fountain Pedricosa
description: Water fountain source. Clean water for drink. Public space.

name: Fonte Castelo arouce
description: Small public fountain with fresh water near to castel and river beach.

name: Quinta do Rossi
description: A farm for caravans, motorhomes and wild camping.

name: Casa do Preto
description:
What a good Restaurant. they have traditional food from the area. I had fish - menu was 20$. Kind of hard to find.

Unfortunately just accessible for travelers with smaller cars or Motorbike. Amazing view to the lake and just crossing the tiny town is worth coming here... Everything bigger then a Defender is not recommended...  Enjoy the meal.

name: Peniche Informal Campsite
description: Informal, (still) free,  but officially tolerated campsite. Opposite of Baleal Beach Parking, where overnight staying/camping is not tolerated. Narrow but very long sandy parking. Even and good informal camping vibe. 2min walking from Bar da Praia

name: Wonderful spot next to Lagoa da Vela
description: We pitched our tent here on a saturday night, super quite, some vans on the Other side of the lake. Beautiful Sunset and sunrise! Picnic table.

name: Quinta do Rebentão
description:
August: 1 adult € 3.20; 1 small tent € 2.60; 1 motorcycle € 2.00.
Small cmapground, nice enough bathrooms and showers.
Swimming pool € 1.50 if you're staying at the camp.

name: Parque de Campismo de Penacova
description: Small, quiet cmapground by the river, mostly for frequent visitors. Good enough bathrooms. In september, 1 adult 5€, 1 small tent 4€, 1 motorcycle 4€.

name: Camping Milfontes
description:
[beware that there are two campgrounds next to each other]

September, 1 adult € 4.55, 1 small tent € 5.40, 1 motorcycle € 3.30

Staff is bureaucratic as hell, campsite is yet another where people pay yearly to park their trailer. The bathrooms are actually quite good.

Some spots are sandy, nice for tents, not so nice for wheels.

name: Parque de Campismo de Castelo de Bode
description: Depending where you come from you may or may not see indications on the road. Next to a river dam. Bathrooms are acceptable.

name: Café Odeon
description:
Crazy cheap and mind blowing pancakes!
If you want to have an incredible breakfast/lunch/dinner in a little local restaurant with the most friendly service this is the place!

name: Tasca do Isaias
description: Just perfect. The fish is amazing and the wine is even better. Must go.

name: Area descanso Fátima
description:
Moderator Note: This Place is rejected as rest stops do not necessarily permit overnight camping and it is not clear that the User stayed overnight.

Has a wc. Resting place for picnic. Parking spots for campers and nature.

name: Rio Ferreira
description: Several flat spots in the wooded area near the Ferreira river. Easy access. The larger parking area near the bridge is obvious, but there were quite a few motorbikes and 4x4’s passing nearby, so we followed the trail upstream to a quieter spot. Old fire pits around the area suggest the spot is frequently used for camping. Relatively free of trash.

name: parking on a hill - easy to level
description:
Just a chickentrail so you don't disturb anyone.
please don't leave toilet paper or any other garbage.
By day you hear passing vehicles.
Follow this way and you find another hill to stop an (which has a bypass too). Go even further with a hard climb you find a plateau which gives you a magnificant view of the surrounding hills.
Absoluteley silent.

name: In the forest
description:
Tiny spot next to a 'next to road' road. ;-)
Silence, wind, 4G, no astra without autoskew, nothing in special, just silence, lack of people, got spot for meditation.

name: behind nowhere
description: just a place to park and have some walks. silence, 4g, no astra without autoskew, stunning view

name: Sao bras biker
description: Double bed in house with WiFi water bike repairs

name: Barragem dos Minutos
description: Wild camping by the Minutos reservoir, very quiet and beautiful view.

name: Camping Cepo Verde
description: Campground in the Montesinho Natural Park. Modern and clean Facilities, Restaurant and a nice Pool in a beautiful Landscape.

name: Portonovo
description: An excellent old style auto electrician who sorted multiple issues with my motor home

name: Torrão
description: A public car park right on the river where the Douro tributaries meet. The are a few flat places and others that need levelling ramps. Local fishermen and visitors to the bar/restaurant but an amazing place for a night. No facilities

name: Casa Pedra Nobre
description:
Camper and motorbike friendly bed and breakfast.

If on your roundtrips you need a good shower, a very nice bed, a great breakfast ... stop here.
There is parking space for the camper (no sleeping in the camper).
Free to empty toilet and fill water tanks.

name: Camping Serrão
description: Open all year. Large, ultra clean site will all amenities located 7 mins from Amoreira Beach or Aljezur. I am here during Covid and it’s very very quiet. Cost was €11 for one person, motor home and electric hook up.  there is a shop.

name: Moto3Tempos
description:
Motorcycle mechanic and motorcycles/parts seller.
KTM agent but also repairs other brands.

Pedro is an excellent mechanic.

name: Gas bottle refill - E. Leclerc petrol station
description:
Gas bottle refill - E. Leclerc petrol station
They have a few adapters but only local. Speaking English, no issues with filling the bottle.

name: Termas de Nisa
description:
Service area for campingcars, with 4 places to park, with water, electricity, waste beans.
Free water. Dump station. WC cleaning.
Nice calm and secure place to overnight and really nice swimming pools at the Termas de Nisa.

name: Public bathroom and shower
description:
Free public bathroom and shower.
Can also get water from it

name: Monte Gordo Campsite
description: This is an established camping ground. One minute from the beach.

name: Riverside
description: This a caravan park right by the river.

name: Auchan fuel station
description:
Fuel station with sanitary dumping station.
Also has LPG fill point
And like most gas stations has a pump for the tires and water

name: A Casa do Lago
description:
Paulo and Natalia are the most hospitable and friendly people you can find in this part of Portugal! They are avid travellers themselves (converted an ambulance!) so they know exactly what a tired traveller needs. 

Amazing garden (Paulo is a professional gardener), two lovely dogs, plenty of space, dozens of travels stories and millions of tips where to go and what to do around the entire of Portugal. 

If you’re passing by this part of the country - make a stop at Paulo’s place. You can stay in your van or rent a room, take a hot shower or enjoy a bbq and cool garden shades. 

This is the place to relax, unwind and recharge your batteries (also literally your van batteries :D), before you continue your travels. 

Just visit here and thank me later!

name: barragem da california
description: good spot to rest 1 to two days, very calm.

name: Parque de Campismo do Merujal
description:
A very nice camping with everything you need to refeel your needs and keep going. Managed by locals and they made a very nice local dish.
Recomended!

name: Parque de Autocaravanismo de Souselo
description:
Place for 4 caravans and utilities, but i didn't explore which. Power connections at least.
The entrance is at a steep incline.

name: Continente
description: supermarket with designated sanitary dump station

name: Barragem da Meimoa
description:
WILD CAMPING IS LEGALLY FORBIDDEN IN THE WHOLE COUNTRY
.....
Secluded shore front camp site. Great for a private swim with soft beach. Plenty of space for parking away from dirt road for an all terrain vehicle or motor bike.

name: Virgilio Barros 4x4 mechanic
description:
Top notch professional mechanic, specialized in Land Rover, but fixed our Toyota Landcruiser with an electrical problem. Very friendly, immediate service at very low cost. Phone numbers: see business card. Second number speaks excellent English. Highly recommended!
Next to a restaurant too!

name: Orbitur Montargil
description: Good conditions, nice prices, accepted motorbikes

name: Isolated Paradise
description:
I offer a few campervans and tents pitches in my isolated paradise. A change of scenery is guaranteed in an old farm of 20 hectares away from the eyes and the neighbors, all in the middle of nature! 

About 5 places are available for campervans. 

We are in the early stages of the project but it is possible to use water from a garden hose, to recharge your batteries and to use the wifi near my house for an additional cost. It is forbidden to dispose of waste water! 

The sites are located in a freshly cut oat field, it is possible to walk around, observe the fauna and flora, swim in a dam, or even have a picnic. Smoking is strictly prohibited in the fields due to the high risk of fires!

Prices: 

The price is 10€ per night or 2 hours of work in the morning. I need help to move fences and other simple work . 

5€ to fill your water tank max 60 liters, water is a rare commodity here, I advise you to fill your tank elsewhere if possible)
4€ for the batteries to charge in my garage
2€ for the wifi

Proceeds will be used to fund the reforestation of the estate, to implement a project based on the benefit of a healing sound place, and to build an eco-camp with dry toilets, showers and outdoor kitchens.

Location:
The location indicated is very close to the actual location. Send me a message before your arrival at +351 968 360 034 so that I can give you the best route. The road is narrow and in bad condition but accessible.

Do not hesitate to contact me for more information! 
-------

Je mets à disposition quelques emplacements campervans et tentes dans mon paradis isolé. Dépaysement assuré dans une ancienne ferme de 20 hectares à l’abri des regards et des voisins, le tout en pleine nature ! 

Environ 5 places disponibles pour campervan. L’autonomie totale est conseillée pour profiter du lieu au mieux.

Nous sommes aux prémices du projet mais il est possible d’utiliser de l’eau depuis un tuyau d’arrosage, de recharger vos batteries et d’utiliser le wifi près de chez moi pour un coût supplémentaire. Il est interdit d’éliminer ses eaux usées ! 

Les emplacements se situent dans un champ d’avoine fraîchement coupé, il est possible de se balader, d’observer la faune et la flore, de se baigner dans un barrage, ou encore de piqueniquer. Il est strictement interdit de fumer dans les champs à cause des risques élevés d’incendies !

Prix : 

Le prix est de 10€ la nuit ou de 2h de travail en matinée. J’ai besoin d’aide pour déplacer des barrières et d’autres travaux assez simples. 

5€ pour remplir votre réservoir d’eau max 60 litres, l’eau est une denrée rare par ici, je vous conseille de remplir votre réservoir ailleurs si possible)
4€ pour les batteries à charger dans mon garage
2€ pour le wifi

Les recettes serviront à financer la reforestation du domaine, à mettre en œuvre un projet basé sur le bienfait des fréquences vibratoires, et à construire un éco-camping avec toilettes sèches, douches et cuisines extérieures.

Localisation :
La localisation indiquée est très proche de la localisation réelle. Envoyez-moi un message avant votre arrivée au  +351 968 360 034 afin que je vous indique le meilleur itinéraire. La route est étroite et en mauvais état mais accessible.





N’hésitez pas à me contacter pour plus d’infos !

name: Praia fluvial do Sobreirinho
description:
Natural and isolated environment that breathes a lot of tranquility.

You must be careful with the access path, it is not too wide and it is not paved, there are some potholes, but it is a place very close to Tomar and it is really worth it.
Little mobile coverage.

name: Above the river
description: About 10m above the river (still water when we where there). Flat and large space.

name: Large lake
description: Flat space under a tree, next to a large lake. Beautiful views over the lake at sunset. During our stay it was a bit windy.

name: Wild Forest in the corner
description: Native forest with water fountain, good to put tent hammock and sleep, shower with fountain mineral water. In the side of street on the corner of. You have to be discreet to enter and not make noise, dogs bark in other properties, but this place was recommended by Portuguese who have already camped in the place.

name: Parque de Merendas (Picnic park)
