description: Water fountain in the middle of forest, near the picnic park in Portuguese called (Parque de merendas). Near the road, birds singing a lot very beautiful. The entrance is closed picnic park before when you go down to.

name: Lagoa Comprida
description: Next to Lagoa Comprida. There are people parking right next to the lake, but you are in plain view (quite a bit of day tourism) and open to the elements. This spot is just behind the corner in and old stone quarry, clean and very protected from the weather. Also completely out of sight. Great cloud formations most evenings. To get here, you have to pass right in front of the little shops and follow that track for a few hundred meter.

name: Vila Rea Camping Site
description: Municipal Camping Site of Vila Real, nearly swimming pool. The price for one person and one tent is about 6,45 Euros. Hot shower, electricity, water, and more. you can see in the website campingvilareal.com

name: Florestal Park of Paços de Ferreira
description: Wild Forest beside of Paços de Ferreira Park, following the streaming inside of forest after the bridge where you can find a stairs walkway.

name: drinking water fountain
description: Sink and drinking water fountain near the road

name: Café Torre do Pinhão
description: Bar, mini market and restaurant in Pinhão Village.

name: streaming water
description:
streaming water fountain natural in the middle of forest, 

Moderator note: Location is unclear but matches google maps on Image. please verify and remove this comment.

name: Forest near Freixo and Capela Santa Bárbara
description: Wild Forest and streaming fountain water

name: Restaurant and Cafe bar
description: Portuguese cafe and restaurant here are perfect

name: Controlled water fountain
description: Sink and water from fountain in a  Portuguese village.  free and drinkable

name: Miradouro water fountain
description: Controled water at fountain of miradouro viewpoint. They said can not drink but if you have a portable filter or another.

name: miradouro hotel
description: Hotel near miradouro of water fountain and square

name: tinhela river
description: Big river with camping area around good spot

name: Bar restaurant
description: bar restaurant in the Murça village and supermarket

name: Repsol gas station
description: In the middle of Murça village near Auchan Supermarket

name: Restaurante Borges
description: portuguese restaurant and Cafe in the village

name: River and forest before Franco's Village
description: Amazing place, clean water many trees and just be careful to go down, following the patch, as someone had done  before.

name: Fontes dos diamantes in Franco village
description: Controled water fountain in the middle of Franco's Village

name: Picnic park and Fountain in the road
description: Picnic park and water fountain besides of the road.

name: Camping ground of Mirandela
description: The campground of Mirandela is closed for COVID rules, but they have another caravan spot and you can use the parking lot there, no tents just caravans.

name: Lidl and pingo doce Supermarket
description: Lidl and pingo doce Supermarket are very close to each other.

name: Pingo doce camping
description: Informal camping site besides pingo doce Supermarket, but it's dirty

name: Wild Forest Beside the Road
description: Wild Forest beside the road with mineral water fountain.

name: Controled water fountain
description: Controled water fountain of the village Vilar de Pedra

name: Pousadas
description: Pousada and hotel for tourists and travelers in Portugal.

name: Casas de campo hotel
description: Casas de campo hotel in the middle of the village

name: Vimeiro water fountain
description: Good water to drink and other, small village very beautiful

name: CEPSA
description: CEPSA gas station and others as convenient shop, restaurant

name: Azibo Camping Site
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Wild camping is not prohibid on Portugal, the people don't know how the law works, if you need just one night sleep it's ok. On Porto and in Lisbon have so many people living in the street and who want to say that you can't just sleep in the middle of the forest to surviver. You can ask this information in some guys specialist no for everyone who don't know. 

there is great poetry on the part of the Azibo administration Because in this park People who use cars also use tents they sleep inside the car they sleep outside the car in tents and this happens to many of the people who are inside the cars and also Some cyclist gets installed in the middle of cars to sleep with tents So there is a big lie on the part of the administration of Parque Azibo

only car, caravan, motorhome are allowed here, not tents, if you want to call to the administration of the park this is the number +351278420420 This rules are available for any place around the lake and river. They have some fiscalization, some ciclist are joining to the caravan people to have condition to sleep between the cars with tents.  You can find lot of spots and small beach around.

name: Parking at Pena village
description:
This village is at the end of a mountain switchback narrow road. The last stretch that takes you down to the village may be difficult for RVs but it's doable. 

During the day the space for parking may be full due to the two restaurants but it'll dwindle at night.

The scenery is amazing, especially if you drive from Arouca on a motorcycle.

name: Azibo Camping Spot
description: Wild Forest near the river in the fountain. You can sleep good, here is very cold. During the night Javali porc around just a few times.

name: Quintela de Lapaças Water fountain
description: Water fountain of Quintela de Lapaças near Azibo beach.

name: Santa Comba de Rosas Square
description: In the square of the village there is a small sanctuary with a controlled water fountain.

name: Controled water fountain
description: Village controlled water fountain in the middle of the way.

name: Paços de Sortes fountain
description: Controled water fountain near Paços de Sortes village

name: Serra da nogueira water fountain
description: The best and cold water I found in this N15 road. from the largest forest, they have castanha de Portugal and the climate in summer is perfect.  The water came from nogueira mountain, but the place of the fountain is called mosquedo. All of people stopped by car and take the water.

name: Fountain nossa senhora da serra
description: Fountain with controlled water, but maybe doesn't always work. The Portuguese man said they sometimes turn off the water, but worked for us.

name: Sarzeda bridge
description: Wild camping near the bridge and drinking water

name: Diamond café
description: Diamond cafe and restaurant in the entrance of the Bragança

name: Two gas stations
description: CEPSA and Galo gas station in the same place.

name: Riverside
description: Near the small chapel Sanctuary Santa Rita 1714. Follow the river in walkway outside of the castle and you will find lots of camping sites near the river, the only problem is, be careful when you go down to the river, try to find some good path. Don't camp near the village or castle: the water can't be good as it smells. This wild camping site place is near natural water and came from another natural fountain and didn't have the village nearby. Better to always have portable filter. There is another river after the road in this same way and the water may be better but it is farther from the village Bragança or Take water in the fountain near the old bridge outside the castle.

name: Fluvial beach in forest
description: Follow the way outside the castle and pass the bridge. Go until this point and coordinates. Just following the river. Take water in the fountain near the old bridge outside the castle.

name: Riverside
description: When you find the entrance, following down, it's an abandoned way. The river water was not so good. It came from Bragança and was a little bit dirty. But it you want to just put up a tent and sleep, this place is good. Bring water to drink and shower if you need. Take water in the fountain near the old bridge outside the castle.

name: Old bridge water fountain
description: Drinking water fountain outside of the Bragança castle near the ancient bridge. I tried some and the drink is perfect. This is the same route to the camping site registered following the river outside of the Bragança castle. You can get free water before going to sleep there.

name: Campervan site
description: Find free water in the campervan site and bathroom also.

name: Tents and Campervan site
description:
Bathroom and toilet in the campervan site near the Bragança castle.  
Tents are allowed for pilgrims of Camino de Santiago, If you have questions call the number 117, Car, campervan, motorhome, caravan only. They have lot of places around the castle, free controlled water and bathroom.  The water is available all the time but the bathroom I think just until 6 pm.

name: Bridge side
description: Camping besides of Luis I bridge in Douro River.

name: Fonte da Rua Chan
description: Street cham fountain 1852 years old batalha

name: Water source with faucet
description: This water source is commonly used by locals.

name: Unhais da Serra river beach
description:
This place is a free caravan park.
It has toilets (i saw it been cleaned every morning), cold showers, drinkable water source, sink for dish washing and barbecue.
At the end of the caravan park there are some trees that i used for camping.

name: Overnight at Praia da Alagoa
description:
Big parking lot used by day by the locals to access the beach.
At night only us stayed here. Quiet. Please clean and don't throw garbage.
There is a toilet near.

name: Parking and Overnight at Praia Grande
description:
Near city of Pera, on the way to the beach a big parking lot.
All around is a Natural Park, but you can stay one night at the border of the parking place. We stood here with our roof tent and several Motor homes also. Very nice and quiet.
Do not litter. Keep nature clean.

name: Parking and Overnight at Praia de Mira
description:
When you reach the Praia de Mira, head to your left and go to the end of the road.
There is a huge parking lot where vans, campers and Motorhomes spend the night. Quiet and near the beach.
Toilet available.

name: Rio Dão. Damm and River
description:
Very nice place just at the lake.
Large and quiet.
Go to the end of the Foz do Dão Street. Many places to stay. Free and beautiful. Warm water to swim. You can even dive here.

name: Jogis Farm
description: Relaxed place in the forest, with lake, ducks and turtles. Wifi available. There are already a few campervans and a tipi where you can stay, in case you‘re traveling without car. Jogi is always happy when people visit and even stay a bit longer to leave some joy. Bring some vegs/fruits

name: Motorhome Ecopark São Brás de Alportel
description: Park for motorhomes, campers and caravans situated between the mountains and the sea, at a short driving distance from several beaches and towns like Faro, Loulé and Tavira (Algarve Portugal),surrounded by holm oaks, cork oaks and carob trees, and away from overcrowded tourist centres. Set in a 56 000 square meters of land. very good Wifi connection. Several restaurants and supermarkets nearby. Opening hours - 8.00, closing hours – 20.00 (winter) 21.30(summer). overnight stay- 7€; eletricity - 4€; Laundry - 4€; toilette - 1€ person /day; hot showers - 1€/5 minutes.

name: Motorhome Ecopark São Brás de Alportel
description: Park for motorhomes, campers and caravans situated between the mountains and the sea, at a short driving distance from several beaches and towns like Faro, Loulé and Tavira (Algarve Portugal),surrounded by holm oaks, cork oaks and carob trees, and away from overcrowded tourist centres. Set in a 56 000 square meters of land. very good Wifi connection. Several restaurants and supermarkets nearby. Opening hours - 8.00, closing hours – 20.00 (winter) 21.30(summer). overnight stay- 7€; eletricity - 4€; Laundry - 4€; toilette - 1€ person /day; hot showers - 1€/5 minutes.

name: Motorhome Ecopark São Brás de Alportel
description: Park for motorhomes, campers and caravans situated between the mountains and the sea, at a short driving distance from several beaches and towns like Faro, Loulé and Tavira (Algarve Portugal),surrounded by holm oaks, cork oaks and carob trees, and away from overcrowded tourist centres. Set in a 56 000 square meters of land. very good Wifi connection. Several restaurants and supermarkets nearby. Opening hours - 8.00, closing hours – 20.00 (winter) 21.30(summer). overnight stay- 7€; eletricity - 4€; Laundry - 4€; toilette - 1€ person /day; hot showers - 1€/5 minutes.

name: Praia de Monte Clerigo
description: A huge beach on the shore of Atlantic Ocean. Strong current - good for surfers, etc. A few lots of free parking.

name: Porto
description: Shop filled with wonders, great music  and an unexpected garden

name: Intermarché
description: The Intermarché grocery have a fuel station, a dump station and a water station.

name: Camping Trinidade
description: A campground for about 50 campers with a restaurant, toilet, shower, water, dump station, wifi. It’s not the cleanest campground but it does the job. There is a gate and the security is good. It costed us 14€ for one night with electricity. Wifi cost 3€ per day.

name: Parque do Rio Silves
description: Secured parking for camper. No trees, no beach, no playground. Just a parking area with utilities. There is a gate and you must check-in before 18:00.

name: Albufeira campground
description: Huge campground with all the commodities that you could imagine. It cost us 13€ for the van, two adults, electricity and wifi. There is a discount if you plan to stay for more than 30 days. There is also a bus stop near so you can take the local commute to go the Albufeira downtown or at the beach.

name: Praia do Pinheirinho
description:
nice place. the way to the beach is when you walk 100 meters south. follow the footsteps. you need to go down a small canyon. take your trash with you

As per amendments to Portugal’s Highway Code articles 48 and 50-A approved in July 2021, “overnight stays in motorhomes approved by the IMT (Institute of Mobility and Transport) for a maximum period of 48 hours are allowed

name: Lisbon, paid parking 24hrs
description: You have 24 hours for 5 euros at check in date to check out Lisbon by bike or on foot. City centre is pretty close by, it is quiet if only for the distant car noise of the traffic over the bridge. Looks and feels safe to us.

name: Praia da Rocha parking
description: Free parking right next to the road, busy at working hours but free and close to the most beautiful beaches.

name: Tribalcar
description: Proper garage and helpful mechanics with good knowledge. Ask for Pedro, he speaks english and he’s a really handsome man. Fixes all types of cars. Good place to check Your car before going further.

name: At the start of Faro
description:
Translation:Good place at the start of Faro quiet at the water's edge

good place au abord de Faro tranquille au bord de l eau

name: Les Geudins
description:
A nice little place at the seaside. 5 min walk to Olhao.
.....
petite plage sympathique au bord de mer, a 5 mn a pied de Olhao

name: Camping os Anjos
description: A very nice smaller camp site run by a Dutch guy.  Everything is very clean and tidy. There are all of the facilities one might expect at a simple camp site.

name: Parque de Campismo Markadia
description: This is a large camp site around the lake formed by the Odivelas dam. If you can get a good spot there are excellent views of the lake. The facilities are generally good (but no wifi!) however it is expensive. I paid €24 per night for a Defender with a roof top tent and without electricity (2021 prices). If the place were cheaper I'd give it a high recommendation.

name: Barragem de Alvito
description: There's a small parking area to the East of the dam with good views of the reservoir. Quite often 1-2 camper vans stay here overnight. It's a very quiet spot.

name: Camping São Miguel
description: This is a good 4 star camp  site. The washroom facilities are excellent. There's shade under the high conifers. The ground is fairly sandy.

name: Auto Volt Lda
description: Good auto electricians. They repaired my alternator (an old Nippon Denso) whereas two others failed. The price was very reasonable too. If you have electrical problems come here.

name: Victor JP Neves
description: Garage specialising in 4x4 esp Land Rovers. I haven't used them myself but they look professional. The manager is a friendly South African guy who has been working on LRs for 25 years.

name: RS motos
description:
normally KTM, Suzuki, Moto Guzzi, etc dealer - also buggies (Polaris)
small shop (parts & cloths) and garage
Portuguese and English speaking

name: Free Water fountain near Arrábida bridge
description: Water fountain near the Ponte da Arrábida, free water fountain clean just up the path near the river and walk way.

name: Parque de estacionamento da Praia de Faro
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:iOverlander cannot verify if wild camping is permitted at this location. It is your responsibility to verify local laws or obtain consent before staying the night. 

Informal campsite. A lot of campers and caravans stand here. Sound of planes landing and taking off until 11.30 PM. No electricity. Did not see any water spots as well. Nice place tough to meet other travelers. 

https://goo.gl/maps/QnFvXpXx9J7YBAMUA


For water/ showers or electricity and WiFi go to the beach. 1km walk.

name: Free water fountain
description: free fountain near the bridge Infante Dom Henrique, they have a public vegetables garden around

name: Campsite on the cliff of Douro River
description: Informal camping site in the middle of the Porto city, near Fontaínhas and Douro River.

name: Under the bridge wild camping site
description: Following under the bridge you can find places to use hammock and tents, very useful here and secure.

name: Viriato Balneário, Públic showers bathroom
description: Balneário do Viriato, is a public shower bathroom, you have Landry and hot shower just for 0,50 cents Euro. Works just on weeks days from 9:00 til 17:00. Near have a free Water fountain

name: Free water fountain
description: Free water fountain on the walkway of Douro River.

name: CMP Balneário Hotshower
description: Balneário Público with hot shower and towel, for just one euro. In front of Continente Supermarket and the Bus station Campo 24 de Agosto.

name: Bus Station and Toilet 24 Agosto
description: Campo 24 de Agosto Bus station and There have Toilet and many stands fast food and others and also lockers for the luggage and backpack

name: Free water fountain near bridge
description: Free water fountain near the bridge Ponte da Arrábida on Douro River

name: Bathroom and shower free
description: Bathroom and shower free in the square near the hospital.

name: Super Book Arena
description: Water fountain, toilet, park and picnic places at Casa do Rosário and Super Book Arena one of the best view point of Porto.

name: Camping Orbitur Cascais
description: Nice place close to guincho beach, complete.  we paid 20 euros for two people and the motorhome

name: Praia de Torrao do Lanier
description: Parking spaces at the end of a track/road next to the ocean. No one overnighting other than a couple of fishermen (local). No one took any notice of our small 4x4. Other potential camping spots in the surrounding woodland.

name: Praínha Bar
description:
Natural flat área with direct river access.(Douro river)
). It has a bar (open between 11am and 11pm) and piknik area . to overnight you have to ask permission to the bar staff. They always agree.

name: Boulder beach
description: flat area by the lake. excellent for wild camping. space for more than 10 vehicles vehicles with low ride (low suspension) will have to be careful but doable. VW Passat made it easy.

name: Praia de vale dos homens
description: A quiet place for where you can enter with a 4x4, near some cliffs and sea views

name: Campervan Park - Vieira de Leiria
description:
Private park.
At this early stage with the conditions described.
More information by phone - 965370199
--
Parque privado.
Nesta fase inicial com as condições descritas.
Mais informações por via telefónica - 965370199

name: Quinta das Lameiras
description: Our simple organic farm (Blue House, 60) is located 10 km from the Templar city of Tomar and 3 km from the Castelo de Bode dam. Ideal for visiting the town of Tomar and the Convento do Cristo. We have enough space for mobile homes, caravans and some tents. Access to private bathroom, electricity and drinking water, we look forward to welcoming you. Do not hesitate to visit our profile on Instagram (quinta_das_lameiras) or FB (Quinta das Lameiras - Sº Pedro de Tomar). We sell products from our farm and other farmers. Depending on the season we have vegetables, fruit, eggs, cream cheese, cottage cheese, oil and duck, lamb, chicken and turkey. Each family can pay for what they want or can help preserve and improve the space. Being happy is the most important! Please contact us before you come. Our backyard is the world!

name: Deadens Picknick area with BBQ‘s
description: Deadend Picknick area with BBQ‘s and tap water, toilet where closed end of April. Next to side road with decent traffic. Illuminated spot throughout the night. Quiet for one night to spend. Nearly even terrain.

name: Free parking and for a small campevan camping spot
description: In a nice neighborhood, flat parking area . Not for large Rv’s but good for small size campervans .

name: Picknick area
description: Nice Picknic area. Beach 800m away. There is a parking lot also. The parking lot is 500 m from the beach. Very quiet. We were there one night

name: Beach Camping Moreiro
description: Road near the Beach is very quiet. Road is not for big rigs, but medium rigs are okay

name: Stone house
description: Place near the stone house, beside a chapel.

name: Unser the Bridge
description: Ares from the City  for Camper, with water electricity for each van.

name: O Tempo
description: Nice small site. Xavier is a very polite and helpful manager. We had a problem with our water pump. He fixed it without any charge. He said it a service for my guest. The facilities are clean everything without additional cost.

name: View Point
description: Nice Place with view on the Duoro River. Must See!

name: Barril de Alva
description: Nice space with 20 - 30 sites. Next to s river we you can swim.

name: Church
description: Big Site near a church. With a great view over The Valley.

name: Miranda do Corvo
description: Sites for motorhomes. Good for one night.

name: R. Santana
description: Caravan Service Station. 25 RV Sites. It is in the City.

name: Open forest loft
description: Beautiful place inland, far from routes/coast in the middle of the forest. Big enough for 4 tents on the side of the unpaved road and  much more for campers. Easy access. Any kind of wheel is welcome. Birds, smell of eucalyptus tree and tranquillity are the senses. Out of arrifana wind and risks. Nature in!!

name: Monsaraz
description:
fountain with fresh Ester
follew the way from Monsaraz to centro nautico. half way one the left side. there ist also a sign from the road "fontanario"

name: Malcata
description: This is a run down city camping area. Toilets and dump station are good. Plenty of places to park, and a bbq. There’s a basketball court and a soccer field as well. All free.. Nobody here. There’s water.

name: Malcata City Camping - free
description: This is a run down city camping with good places to park, a clean enough toilet and a dump station. All free. There’s a basketball court and a soccer field as well. BBQ available. No shower. There’s water.

name: Sagres Bicycle
description: Bicycle and Surfshop. Repairs bicycle. Nice owner.

name: Residencial Ponto Grande
description: Basic, clean and awesome! Very affordable hotel, I paid 30 Euro for a double room for one person. Great location in heart of town. Amazing local food in the restaurant... and it's cheap! I paid 15 Euro for 3 course lunch, including 500ml of wine and a glass of port ....and coffee! Quite large street parking in the front of hotel - good for motorcycles, cars, van  and small campers.

name: Mata Nacional do Valado
description: It is a great place, close to an established campsite, it is on the Travessa da Fontinha Sul access that leads to Monte São Bartolomeu.  There are some tables and grills.

name: Alcoutim Public Parking
description:
Public parking area near to the public bath at the river and nearby the small village. it's a five minutes walk to the bath and in the village with small restaurants and a small supermarket (mini mercado, Mo. - Fri. 9am - 7pm, Sat. 9am-3pm) as well. There also a parking area next to the river and the cafe, but not very huge and not so good for bigger vans or big rigs. its really quiet at night. nobody bothered us. (4G with Orange). Free wifi in the cafe next to the public bath. Toilets and cold shower at the bath.
cold drinks and some fast food for a good price at the bar/restaurant next to the bath.

name: Aldeia do Mato
description:
Nice spot for one, two or more nights. it's a huge parking area made of gravel with bbq area, trash bins, benches and water tap. a bit further is a beach on the lake with bar/snack bar located. (praia fluvial) . Toilets and cold shower near the bar. A bit busy during holidays and weekends but still ok and quiet at night. 
(Poor reception with NOS.)

name: Cais de Bernado
description:
Parking and picnic area. with benches, tables and grill. also a toilet container with running water. water tap (push). nice view to the river and the hills opposite.  quiet at night.  We stayed three nights (on weekend, and in October) without any problems. 
(4G with NOS). The road down is a bit narrow but also possible for bigger trucks. 
Follow the blue sign "cais de bernardo". 
Best option is to come from the west side. 

(two dogs running around)

name: V. N. Ceira
description:
Here is a very nice river bath nearby a small village. we stayed here for two nights. very quiet.  Facilities are closed (off season). water is running. flat sandy ground.  Picnic benches, grills and trash bins. 
(3G NOS)

name: wild parking near the river
description:
The other two spots near by were very narrow and barely has space for the van without blocking the way.
in this place there is slightly more space for one camper van. the nice thing here is that you have space to turn around.  On another place you may have to travel far to take the U-turn.

name: comfortable place at the side of the road
description:
quiet flat place at the side of almost not used country road.
comfortable dirt road.

name: Guarda
description: Water fill, dump water and toilet cassette dump.

name: Portuguese/Spanish frontier
description: Small quiet spot with 2 concrete tables and nice view on the lake. GPS don't know this little road but follow Casa das aribas sign and go a little further. Ok for vans but not for big rigs and no services.

name: parque de campismo do Bostelim
description:
Cheap campground by a river beach.
ita has hot water showers and electricity included, also has tables and benches along with BBQ and a sink.

name: Casa da horta
description: This place is a little restaurant near the road to the beach. Because it is not allowed to stay overnight at the beach parking, this is a good alternative. The place is a little basic, but the restaurant is nice and you don’t have to pay for parking and sleeping in the car. The condition is: take some meal or breakfast at the owners restaurant. There is a toilet and shower room for the place and it is clean.

name: water valve, tables and toilet
description:
Very nice place with a spigot to fill the tank and a very nice and clean toilet. Tables and shadow. 
it is nicer filling here than in the autocaravan service at alferce (need to press the water botton)button. I will empty the tank above, then fill it here.

name: Furnas Campsite
description:
Sitecamp with hot shower, cafeteria, plenty of places to camp.

there is also BBQ

name: Custóias Metro Stop
description: Near metro stop station of Custóias, water and tank to drink and wash clothes.

name: Nice beach parking
description:
Beautiful parking close to the beach. Container bar on the scene providing fresh beer and snacks and (container) restrooms.

Fresh water and cold outdoor shower for free.

Bonus points for military airbase random shows on scene (helicopter search and rescue training, WWII aircraft, F16 low pass)

Police showed up but did not bother anyone. Please keep site superclean.

name: Anta de Melriça - Castelo de Vide
description:
Dolmen composed of four granite pollards of regular rectangular ágape and covered by a triangular shaped hat. Remains of the primitive tumulus are visible. It is classified as a National Monument.
Note that this Monument is located on private property. Best to request a visit +351245908220.

name: São Jacinto  Only 4x4!!
description: Very nice place to spend the day, by the beach. Only 4x4!!

name: Aldeia da luz campervan
description: Free and official parking space with water and cleaning station. very close to the beach.

name: Antonio Silva Workshop
description: Decent mechanics, sensible pricing, friendly staff. Got a cooling hose replaced and was very happy with the service. No shiny workshop, but these guys sure know their job.

name: Parking lot close to Praia da Fincha Grande
description: Parking lot just before the trail to the beach with amenities but pretty comfortable for wild camping. We stayed the night and had no problems, the guy who was watching the area said it’d be ok to camp.

name: Freixieiro de Soutelo
description: little open flat field next to river, 20m away from a waterfall with very clear water. Could easily have a swim.

name: Foz do Sousa
description: Restplace next to river. Has stone benches and tables. Quiet place l, though visited by locals mainly in the weekend for picnics and bbq's.

name: Bucelas
description:
Paved parking and paved street. Ideal to rest at night during the trip.
---
Estacionamento com calçamento e rua asfaltada. Ideal para descansar a noite durante a viagem.

name: Barrage
description: This is one of the beautiful spots around this lake. We stayed in August for two nights, nobody seen. You can take a swim, watch birds and rest. Ultimate! A standard driver can reach it in any car. Pets shouldn’t disturb birds!

name: Vale dos Guenos
description: If you are ready with the enormous number of people on the Algarve-beaches, roads and city centre’s, consider this place for welcoming relaxing moments. It’s a former motorhome for bikers who had their celebrations. Now it is a bit primitive campsite ran trough a mother and her son. If you like shadow…there’s not a lot. Amenities…one toilet and one cold shower. Bar/restaurant…the son will serve you drinks and custom made food if you like. So, it’s a bit alternative, but friendliness and the sound of nothing overrules everything! We paid 10,00 euros, they will charge you 2,50 extra if you need electricity.

name: Potable spring water
description: This is a spring showed us by a local. He told us that the other spring is non-potable at time of our visit.

name: private place
description: private place to pass the night with Water and calm spot

name: Cortiçarte – cork processing
description:
A most interesting place: see almost endless piles of harvested cork, ready to be processed.
If you are lucky, a member of this 4th generation family business takes time to explain the essentials of this fascinating natural product!
The shop offers a very broad range of locally manufactured products … much more relaxed than in the packed shops in Évora, definitely not ‚Made in China‘ … and definitely around 30% cheaper!

name: São Lourenço
description: Que place to stay, with thermal baths. Large park. No services

name: Calm lake
description: After a large dirty road, you can find a big camping site with views of the lake. We thought the lake was really close to our spot but unfortunately the lake its almost empty due to drought. Even so, the views were great. 10 min walk from the lake. Bad internet connection, but you can use your phone. It's really quiet, we didn't see anyone in 3 days.

name: Ponte da Barca
description:
Large shaded car park by the river near the village.

Deutsch
Großer schattiger Parkplatz am Fluss in Ortsnähe.

name: Aire Cc  Coco Eric
description:
Being created. It is an area intended for the reception of motorhomes & vans, quite exceptional in its design.
-----
En cours de création. C est une aire destinée à l accueil des camping-cars & vans tout à fait exceptionnelle dans sa conception.

name: Soure
description: Place with big Space to Stay Overnight vor Campervan. Noch Shadow. 3 Stations to dump your Toilet. Three of charge.

name: Merujal
description: Nice place with a nice view of the mountains , near by the main road.

name: Mikki’s place to stay
description:
Large campsite (150 spots) where semi-permanent and travellers mingle. Relaxed and free atmosphere. Price per night depends on size of plot. Small plot is €12 (without electricity) - €16 (with electricity) per night. €350 per month.
Swimming pool

name: Very Quiet near the lake
description: Flat place near the lake. Quiet. Easy to come. Nobody around.

name: Camping Alcobaça
description: Excellent free camping in the city centre, with electricity, water and free toiletries. Green area, a few meters from shops, restaurants, world heritage sites. Quiet location, with space for 15 motorhomes and dozens of tents. It has a campervan dump area. It is about 10km from Nazare. Great spot!

name: Pedro Marto
description: Place to fill LPG tank, with auto mechanic shop.

name: Monte Velho Beach
description: Small official parking place, next to the beach.

name: Big spot right on the riverbed
description: Established picnic area with some tables further up from where i put the camp, although I asked some peaple to feel the general vibe and everyone just said just camp here.. there is so few people up here in the mountains anyways. I did not have any encounters after I put my camp. Beautiful lake, swingropes, manmade waterfall and good water for swimming. I used the water to boil some pasta and even made coffee with it. Small bar near entrance, dont know about seasonal opening hours but it was closed when i was here.

name: P+R Venda Nova
description:
Quiet RV parking with a dump station for black and grey water.
You can also stay overnight here and take the metro to the city centre. 
Local parking attendant/long-term resident Rui is happy to help.

name: Camping Canelas
description: Site has plenty of shade trees and a relaxed atmosphere, 60% are occupied on a all Yr basis. 3 pools restaraunt where you can have 2 meals and drinks for approx 20£, 2 persons in November 9£ per night. lovely quiet site.

name: Parque de Campismo Rural Lapa dos Gaivões
description:
very interesting place to go hiking and very close to Spain. 

Also very peaceful.

name: Capela de Recanto
description: Hermitage on top of a hill with paved access, very quiet

name: Vehicle Storage Faro
description:
CLOSED PARK BUILDING VIDEO SECURED
Low cost uncovered park and covered spaces for cars, motorcycles and motorhomes, for short or long stays. 5 minutes from the International Faro Airport.

Parking spaces are managed by appointment, always with shuttle service and a person to receive you. Our office is opened from Monday to Friday, from 9am to 6pm.

Ours sites are secure by electric gate, indoor and outdoor alarm and cctv (night and day cameras).

Check our website, reach us if you have any doubt – Vehicle Storage Faro is the right place for you, and the best park for your vehicle.

name: Casa Florestal de Quadrazais
description: Mountain refugein in acceptable condition, with fireplace and several rooms. Old house of forest rangers.

name: Anta da Pedra de Anta
description:
Megalithic monument away from inhabited places and in a very quiet place.
You can spend the night on the esplanade in front of it

name: Alares, aldeia abandonada
description:
Totally abandoned town, without inhabitants.
Far from any populated place.

name: Olhao big parking
description: Big free parkinglot with a lot of campers. Walking distance to beach and restaurants. No facilities

name: Monte Gordo
description: Municipal camp site close to town and across road from beach. A large site with plenty of shaded areas. Facilities are basic but plentiful. A mixture of permanent pitches and campsites.

name: Praia do Lago
description: Wild beach camping. A few metres from the beach. Access is via dirt road but can be used with care by 2wd. Track follows the beach and has a few isolated spots for overnight stops. No facilities but far from prying eyes.

name: Monte Carvalhal da Rocha
description: Established campground with bungalows, tent and vehicle pitches. Level terraces with plenty of trees for shade. Clean toilet and shower block with plenty of hot water. Swimming pool looks amazing but too cold to use in January. Open but reception not staffed when we visited so just parked up and paid later. €12 for 2 adults and 5m vehicle. Bargain. Few hundred metres from beach and amazing cliff top walk. Ostriches, zebras, bison, alpacas and other animals next door.

name: Lidl Albufeira
description: They have 5 marked places for RV's. Allowed overnight. I stayed here with 20 others directly at the entrance of the parking then it's no problem for anyone. Restroom inside the store. 10 minutes walking to the beach. Free wifi in the store. Very helpful employees

name: Next to the beach
description: Big parking lot, grassy land. Direct to the beach, lot of restaurants and Landry nearby. Normal car 3 euro a day, campers 6. Overnight parking allowed. Dump for toilet at the gate

name: Overlander's Valley
description: Private property where it receives travelers from all over the world, who come by bike, on foot or in a 4x4 jeep.  We have a nice space for camping, you can set up a tent or sleep in the car.  we only receive a 4x4 car with a maximum length of 6 meters, access is not very good for other vehicles.  we are creating more and more conditions to receive them, we have electricity, water, Wi-Fi available and we are building a structure to empty the black water.  We are also travelers and we really like to receive them in our space as we are received by the outside world.  we do not require any minimum payment, we accept your offers only for the space to be sustainable.  NOTE: for an overnight stay confirmation by whatsapp 00351913353866 is required

name: Next to the sea
description: Big parking lot. Stayed here with more then 20 others campers. Police drove by with no problems. Direct on the beach with 2 restaurants. Showers only in summer season. No other facilities. Very quiet at night

name: Lidl Supermarkt
description: 5 special places for campers. Open 8-21. Toilets and wifi in the store. Good place for a night. Several restaurants within 100 meters.

name: South of Sines
description: Big grassy gravel spot directly on the cliffs and sea. Amazing vieuw, no signs of not parking and overnight. Stayed with a few more campers

name: small parking lot
description: Small parking lot Just over the bridge at the foundation. Place for 10 campers. Less noice then at the parkinglot from the supermarket at the other site. Supermarket open from 8-21:30 with restaurant, toilet and free wifi. McDonald's 200 m

name: great place in small village
description: Former football field with place for more then 50 campers. They are making a nice camperplace. Free water and dump. Electra too (we came too late in so think somebody is coming for opening the electra system) small café in town for drink and lunch

name: LandSquare
description: Land Rover Mechanics. Very good place to sort out the Defender. English speaking and very helpful.

name: Pedrógão Grande Reservoir
description:
Beautiful place by a chapel. Water and WC available. WC not always open. 
---------------
Schöner Platz an einer Kapelle. Wasser und WC vorhanden. WC nicht immer geöffnet.

name: Parking near Lissabon
description:
Its just a parking place near Lissabon and its a 15min drive to the sea.
The people here are super friendly

name: Side at small lake
description: A small Camping side beside a small lake, there is a Autovia near but you barely hear it depending on the wind. We drove there with a car, stayed one night in car and hammock!

name: Parque de Campismo
description:
Campground with good structure to stay for a period or per night.
Bathroom and hot showers, clean and well mantained.

Paid $7.5 per van, 4.5 per person, 0.71 to use power, $1.0 to complete water. (showers included on price).

Good amenities, safe, close to the beach.

name: Street close to Farol Street
description:
Street without pavement in front of North of Nazare Beach.
We stayed here at night in February (out of season). Quiet and safe place to sleep in front of the beach. No amenities available, informal sleep place.

name: Cosy seaside but restricted van access
description: Very nice parking spot for (small) cars directly at the sea. entry prohibited for van, but with normal car no problem. There are some people in the night for a walk or a cigarette, but nobody talked to us or was disturbed.

name: Obitur Campground
description:
Large campground with full facilities.   Mainly long term rental and cabins but several short stay sites.  €14:50 per night, 2 persons and campervan without hookups.
Frequent bus service to Navarre beach from campground entrance.

name: Ferragudo
description: Run down camper parking with water & sani-dump (€ 3,-)

name: Área serviçio autocaravans Portel
description: Dump station; drinking water & 7 parking spots for RV’s.

name: Supermarket Intermarché
description: Between car laundry & supermarket next to washing machines

name: Motoglobo
description: User-friendly motorcycle parts and repair shop. Sells quality oils. We were allowed to change our own oil in his workshop. Nice guy.

name: Near the river
description: Nice place near the river, the ground is flat an little bit Sandy but it’s ok, easy acces.

name: RV Park
description: This place also called Parque de Pernoita de Autocaravanas. You get water and get off grey/black water.

name: TOPCAR Cartageno & Cartageno VRSA
description: One of the best locations for motorhomes, vans and other vehicles such big rigs. very serious and effective people. maximum confidence. Mechanics for all brands and all vehicles. I was super satisfied

name: Monte vascao, alcatim
description: Currently a camper site.  But if you are nice, you can camp off track.  What is special is that the food here is extraordinary .  Almost worth a Michelin star.  Really great

name: Parque de Campismo Municipal de Faro
description: Looks like a nice place. But not motorcycle friendly. You can park your car and motorhome inside but not a motorcycle. It needs to be parked on the street… so we didn’t stay here as it makes no sense for us.

name: Moto Camp Algarve
description:
Camping based on donations for motorcycle and bicycle travellers. Please contact at least 8 hours before arrival on +351913192243
Toilets, hot showers, washing machine and workshop. 
Also search Moto Camp Algarve on Facebook.

name: Rancho Belchior
description: small campsite, 20 places maximum. Very well maintained sanitary facilities. Alternative furnishing . we paid € 10 for 2 people with jeep and roof tent

name: Setubal Sesimbra
description: Along the road N377 in the environment of te Albufeira Lake

name: Overland_central_portugal
description: Overland Central Portugal is a shared workshop space for vanlife and overland diy'ers to park , build or fix anything from smaller vans to large overland trucks. There is a small communal area, and indoor and outdoor parking areas,  tools, and professional services of steel and wood work,if needed.

name: Quinta do Rio Campsite
description: A beautiful campsite by the riverside. Not much luxury, but all you need.  Follow the signs on the website.  If you want silence....... go here! A lot to do for a 4x4. The owner knows a lot about this area, also very interesting for mtb!

name: Juncal
description: Woods in Juncal. Good for 1 night, 300m gravel/sand from the main road, just 1 car passed by in the evening, good place between beautiful cities

name: Waterfall and small pool on the PR7 trail near Soajo
description:
Fantastic waterfall and small natural pool for a dip on the PR7 hiking trail near Soajo. Perfect on a hot sunny day after a hike up in the mountains. 
No bathing suits - no problem!
Enjoy

name: Praia fluvial Alqueidao
description: Beautiful spot, stayed several nights, swimming possible, quiet, easy road, sun and shadow

name: Mae Home Sol-Foz
description: a few rooms to pick from and motorcycle friendly

name: Mae Home Sol-Carril
description: nice place to stop and rest on your trip

name: Barragem do Maranhão
description: Area with space, plenty trees and close to the Albufeira. Beautiful sunset and sunrise

name: Parque de Campismo da Praia da Areia Branca
description: campground with some spaces for tents. really cheap with 5,12 Euro for 1 tent 1 person 1 motorcycle. many slots are blockt from permanently tents.

name: Forest Praia da Adraga
description: Forest near the Adraga Beach. Big area to camping and restaurant nearby.

name: Praia fluvial do Passadouro
description: Good place to swim in the river down the stairs, with tables and bbq. To sleep good for 1 night, just next to a quiet road

name: Praia fluvial de Vila Boa do Bispo
description: Very nice quiet place at the sandy beach, very good for a swim, few people during the day who park there car along the road and in the wood, flat place for the night in the wood

name: Camping Melides
description: Campground with hot shower's. Everything is clean and the beach is in walking distance. some restaurants are near by.

name: Woods close to rio ferreira
description: Big open space in the woods, next to quiet road, close to river, sandy and grass

name: Wood near Cavado river
description: The 2 praias in the neighbourhood are too crowded to stay for the night, do we found a place in between

name: Praia do Rodanho
description: Next to the beach, just pass the dunes, very quiet open space, sun and shadow, toilets available and bar during the day

name: Near the Minho in Messegaes
description: Very quiet spot along the road that leads to nowhere, only a 5’ walk to the river, in the wood, several flat places next to the road

name: Not far from Poco das Mantes
description: Poco das Mantes us closed for camping, only parking along the road for the waterbassins, we drove further upmountain and found a quiet place next to the road, almost no traffic, good for 1 night

name: between the orange trees
description: Come and visit our Outbase in the South East of Portugal. Our 3.5 hectare site is full of fruit trees such as figs, olives, almonds, carob and of course orange trees. Our goal was to recreate a feeling of wild camping, which is why we didn't create fixed pitches - pick your own spot! After a wonderfully relaxing day or night, you can jump under the (warm) outdoor shower under the almond tree with us.... In short; very close to nature and back to basics. Please take into account check-in time between 5:00 PM and 8:00 PM :)

name: dead end street
description: nice private spot at the end of an unfinished road. very easy to reach with a van.

name: Miradouro Santa Iria
description:
The Santa Iria viewpoint is 5m above sea level and during the day it works as a viewpoint, due to its built-in entrance and further away from the EN1-A it is great to spend the night, there is no water, cover or other amenities!

_____________________________

O mirante de Santa Iria fica a 5m do nível do mar e durante o dia funciona como mirante, por sua entrada embutida e mais longe do EN1-A é ótimo passar a noite, não há água, cobertura ou outras comodidades!

name: Saldanha’s point
description: Saldanha’s viewpoint, it’s near of lunch park, have good water natural source potable, WC and bath point on the sea and rive!

name: Parque infantil e de lazer
description: picnic area with little shade and drinking water. Do not camp for more than one night

name: Senhora da Ribeira
description:
Good place to spend a day, with space to have meals. You can choose to have a picnic (there are even tables available) or eat at one of the beach facilities.
Water not too cold, with regular floor. Space with many shadows and clean.
Bom local para passar um dia, com espaço para fazer refeições. Pode optar por fazer um picnic (há inclusivamente mesas disponíveis) ou comer num dos apoios de praia.
Água não muito fria, com piso regular. Espaço com muitas sombras e limpo.

name: lès Geudins "Progresso" Restaurant Hôtel
description:
not to be missed, 22km north of LEIRIA you will find a restaurant el PROGRESSO traditional traditional cuisine at the price of a trucker, typical Portuguese. you can sleep there too, the boss and her waitress speak French, but beyond you will eat there very well and very good
---
a ne pas louper, a 22km au nord de LEIRIA vous y trouverez un restaurant el PROGRESSO cuisine traditionnelle traditionel au prix d un routier, typique Portugais.vous pourrez y dormir aussi, la patronne ainsi que sa serveuse parle Français, mais au-delà de cela vous y mangerez super bien et tres bon

name: Les geudins Intermarché Gaz 907
description:
here you will find bottled gas 907 and 902
---
ici vous trouverez du gaz en bouteille 907 et 902

name: Ilha do Ermal
description: A very nice place for camping without having to pay, it doesn't have electricity, but it has bathrooms. A very beautiful lake, warm water. It is worth visiting and camping.

name: Sistelo
description: An abandoned quarry, good views and you will only have the company of cows. there is mobile network.

name: Wild camping
description: Wild camping spot. It is in a natural park but we wasn’t disturbed. If you come from setubal and you use google maps : don’t turn at the first indication (a car block the road).

name: Miradouro do picoto
description: Wild camping spot quiet night. If you use google maps you should directily go to the town of azambujeira dos carros.

name: Espinho Minicipal Camping
description: Very basic but safe clean and friendly campsite, near a McD and Supermarket, 25min walk to train station to Porto, €9.50 per night for Land Rover

name: CampingCar Figueira
description: Motorhome Park with 30 places. Beautiful grounds, nice quiet area.

name: Parque Campismo Municipal de Braga
description:
Camping available for RV's, Tends, Caravan.
Located in the city center of Braga, with lots of interesting point of view, history, architecture

name: Wild camp next to sanctuary
description: Perfect spot for a 4x4 car. Upon a mountain in the forest. Overlooking the area and the seashore. Place for 2 vans.

name: Along the beach behind the dunes
description: Wide sandy spot behind the dunes. Save and clean, waking up with the sun and sounds of the ocean. Near a village.

name: Torreira beach
description: Great place by the beach. Only for 4x4. And is quite near from the town

name: Right at the beach
description: Great spot right on the beach. At the back of the sand roundabout we were all alone in a front row spot for the sunset. Quiet night, some walkers passing by during the day. Picked up some trash and left the place cleaner than we found it. We did see a Spanish viper. Didn't do anything to us.

name: Roadside
description:
At the end of a smalltrack, around 300m from tarmac road. No 4x4 is needed and a place for one tent is available. Maybe a small camper van is possible but no big RV.
Place is visible from roads and houses nearby. No shade from sun.

name: Beautiful Camping Spot
description:
Nice big camping place with a great view, 2 minutes from the beach Praia da Foz:) 
We stayed for one night with car and tent…

name: Ocean overview
description: Dead end parking overlooking the ocean and beach. Was here on a Friday night and it was a bit busy. Seems like a semi popular sunset view point. Last part of the road on the way here is very bumpy, but we made it with two campervans. At the very end the road goes down  and some parts get sandy. No amenities like toilets or trash cans available at the spot, but please don’t leave any plastic wipes or toilet paper in nature.

name: Parque Campismo - Barragem Monte da Rocha
description:
campsite with good facilities.  off season pretty empty. some trees. 
not expensive.

name: Parque de Merendas do Bom Sucesso
description: Parking for any type of vehicle, stocked with picnic area with taps and barbecue. There is a tire changing workshop and a small supermarket nearby.

name: Vila Nova de Erra
description:
A new parking spot for Motorhomes (16 places), hard ground, each with electricity, water, facility for grey water, toilet cleaning.
3 Toilets, Showers, a common area with tables, seats, a kiosk, access barrier. Street illumination, quiet
No shade. A meeting point for bikers.
Quite new. Today no electricity, barrier open, kiosk closed.

name: Estacionamento Abrigo da Montanha
description: Great place to spend the night, with more space available compared to Bandeira.

name: Estacionamento do Café Limoges
description: Parking lot at the Limoges cafe, great for spending the night, with a cafe nearby and in a few days a gas station and workshop about 300 meters south of the place

name: VENTO NORTE CARAVAN PARK VILA DO BISPO
description: Place to fill the water tank, wash clothes, dump station or you can stay overnight

name: Water Natural Fountain
description: Natural Water Fountain, on Sintra Mountain, near city village. Cold and clean water where a lot of local have a free

name: Meadow. Rio Tamega
description:
amazing location.
behind the restaurant of a very friendly lady.
not necessary to eat therre, you are welcome.
there are trees for shade.
there is a creek.
the restaurant is also good and cheap.
ordered the rump steak. best one i ever had.
owners speak french.
but with Google Translate, and hands and feet, OK.
very nice and lovely people to speak with.
highly recommended.
i think this is the best place to stay before heading out on the route N2 / Portugese route 66

name: Melides - Free Showers
description: Public toilets with free hot showers. We arrived at 8pm and there was hot water running in the showers. Not sure what time they close or if they turn off the hot water. Bathrooms were clean and the village seems to have a good atmosphere.

name: Herdade do Canelão (motorbikes only!)
description:
Herdade do Canelão is a Guest House located in Western Portugal, exclusively for motorcycle travelers with stories to share.

We are an iOverlander and a Bunk-a-Biker host which is a worldwide community of motorcycle riders who voluntarily provide accommodations to traveling bikers.

We will try to help with everything that you need... for you and for your bike.

Upon reservation, you can stay a maximum of one night.

And if you have time, I will ride with you and show you the best of Western Portugal.

name: large meadow between bridges
description:
when the camperplace is full.

you can park at a large meadow next to it.

park at the tree line and you have shadow.

its next to a 'club' in the weekend change there is loud music.

good for a night.

name: next to church
description:
quit and silence small camper place in litlle Village.
room for 7 / 8 cars.
water/ water dump availble.
some trees for shadow.
Just a real nice tranquilo place.
there are toilets, but off season they where closed.
(september)

name: new service point.
description:
good for a overnight on the road.

5 places, brand New.
clean.
dirt water 
drinking water.

if you need elektrische, you have to get the key by the fire station.

but to stay is free if you dont need elektrisch.

4 picknick benches.

trash can's.

Just a good service point and a stay for the night.

restaurant not to far away.

name: BP station
description: Water tap…..very low pressure. Took about 5 min for 20l. Threads on tap for hose

name: Official Camper Parking
description:
large official free camper parking in town.
trees for shade.
toilets and water.

100 meters from small supermarkt.
restaurant and bar at walking distance.

good for a overnight on the road.

name: Public Wc Station Ferryboat
description: Ferryboat station public toilet and others

name: near the lighthouse
description:
2 parkings spots direct by the lighthouse.

1. in front of the lighthouse.
     you can park next to the fence of the light house.

2. behind the lighthouse.
there is a parking place at the cabo carvoeiro vieuwpoint.

in daytime busy, many tourist, locals come here to watch the view, hike the clifs.

in the weekend some youth will come by later in the evening.
but everything is Chil and ok.

locals are used to campers and van's and are friendly.

the view is stunning, sunset and sun rising both great.

the sound of the sea impressive.

on the parking behind the lighthouse.

a local sells nuts, candy and drinks.

the restaurant is closed, because of  unstable cliffs.

there are toilets but not sure they are functional.

name: Beach View Nazaré
description:
in front of the beach. with excellent view.
Busy in daytime. surfers and locals.
In the evening people come to watch the sunset, when the sun is down it's quiet.

probably you won't be alone, but it is a chill place and everybody minds their own business.

there is a gate at the beginning, 2.20 meters high.

there are beach toilets, but at the end of the day they get locked.

trashcan on the beach.

stunning spot to see the surfers and big waves.

name: Quinta do Retiro
description: Small campsite with natural pool, clean sanitary

name: Beach shower
description: Shower on the beach…free. Cold water…good for a shower if you really need one.

name: Intermache Anadia
description: Quiet location with parking and 24-hour laundry

name: dune trail campsite
description: A nice spot along a sand trail in the dunes. Not sure it's legal but there was no soul there the whole night. It helps that it was October. Access to the beach with a small walk.

name: parking centre ville
description:
free public parking
quiet by the river a stone's throw from the city center.
be careful longer than 6 meters a little tight but it passes for a stopover night
public toilet at the entrance to the car park
and trash
----------
parking public gratuit 
calme au bord de la rivière à deux pas du centre ville.
attention au C.C trop long plus de 6 mètres un peu juste mais ça passe pour une nuit d etape
sanitaire public a l'entrée du parking 
et poubelle

name: river wild camping spot
description: A spot by the river. Water is super calm and warm here. Perfect for a dip. Camping possible for all kinds of rigs. Locals might come to fish. They seem to be fine with it.

name: parking next to church
description:
large parking and allowed to stay overnight.

not so quiet in the morning / day.
cars drive by.

small walk to the beach, centrum town.

restaurant and bars at walking distance

name: Estacionamento
description:
Large parking near the beach behind the dunes.

Wooden path leads to the beach and shower.

Quiet, 

Toilets closed outside the season.

name: Safari Beach lagos
description: Really nice chill hostel . Nice owner , parking safe around . Quiet and calm . With kitchen and every thing

name: Pinhao
description: Hard standing, with space for 2 motorhomes overlooking river Duoro and 5 minute walk from village.

name: Parque de Campismo de Parades de Vitoria
description: Large campsite with many long term/ permanent campers.  However, there is an area for short term travelers.  Close to the beaches and coastal towns.

name: Parque De Campismo Do Escaroupim
description:
Mata Florestal, 2120-018 Salvaterra de Magos
campsite is very shady, in Pine tree forest, with Town of Marinhais close by

name: in the ria - tents only
description: its like a big park, in a Ria, close to aveiro. if you go through the paths, will encounter some many places to pitch a tent. some people pass by, but everything it ok! no litter! no fire!

name: parking lot
description: there is a parking lot for campers, whit some flat space under some pines, near a building. in some point, near 21, 22 , there was people in the building doing some work whit power tools, but no problem at all. chill spot

name: praia de Carvalhal
description: awsome place to spend afternoon and the night. maybe can stay whit a camper, I dont know. Easy to pitch a tent in the nearby area of the parking, so many spots to hide. There its a restaurant in the top of the dune, maybe can ask for water and electricity. I stay in November, no problem at all

name: praia São Torpes
description: place to pitch the tent right in the beach, by the seaside. a free parking for caravans nearby. A bar and a school of surf. all closed, very chill spot , in November

name: LBvia
description:
Note: Coordinates are just about a 100meter south of the actual place. Picture taken from Google (didn't make one myself) 

Garage with about 7 carlifts. Specializes in German cars. 6.15meter/4500kg was not a problem. Looking for help with our gearbox, these people made time for us straight away. Helping us with advise, testdrive, contacts, a rentalcar and even asked if we needed a place to stay. Very polite and professional.

name: PRAIA SANTA RITA SUL Beach
description: Big Carpark at the sea side. Overnight possible. Cars passing by the road, but very few during night time. Beautiful sandy beach with show ers. Awesome sunset.

name: Pico do Futuro
description: Possibly the only coastline park up for a (small!) van. Carparking but not limited to height.

name: Beside Road
description: Gravel parking area next to the road. Good overview, very quiet at night. On the road to the beach.

name: Hill spot camp
description:
Hill top camp at the end of a dirt road
Beautiful sun set over the mountains 
Very quiet
Could be very windy

name: Hill spot with hills and water
description:
Hill spot with water and hills
Lovely spot overlooking water and hills. 
Nice flat spot for a couple of vehicles

name: Lakeside camping
description:
Next to a lovely lake
Plenty of spots around the lake
Camped in Dec
Could hear animals and the occasional car
Bit of rubbish around which is a shame

name: Beach side camping 4x4 only
description:
4x4 only, air down your tyres
Soft sand track down to the beach. 
Lots of camping options 
Lovely views

name: Eucalyptus forest
description: Quiet place with a nice view of the Douro River and Porto. Trail to come here can be a bit technical at times. 4x4 and some experience needed.

name: Free public showers
description: Men and women section. Hot water. Has toilets.

name: Public showers
description: 1€ hot clean public showers. They open every other hour. One hour open, the next closed and so on.

name: RV service
description: 100 liters of water for 2€. You have 5 minutes to fill up. Was open between two and three pm.

name: Beach Parkinglot
description: Parking place right at the beach. We stayed there one night. A few other camper also stayed there. No one botherd us. Quiet, direct on the beach. nice view. there is some water , not Sure is it drinking water.

name: Nazaré Spot at the Beach
description: Nice place 100m from the beach. Very nice and quiet. 4x4 highly recommended!!! Track to the spot is very sandy! Don't forget to deflate your tyres.

name: Camping on the cliffs
description: Along the south side of the Peniche peninsula there are a couple of gravel roads (do able with 2wd). Along these roads there are heaps of fairly level pull outs, some sheltered, some in the open. Some roads are closer to the actual road but still far away enough to hear any noise. These roads are used by local fisherman to get to the cliffs where you can walk down via stairs (great to check out). Insane panoramic views! The marker i’ve put on the map, is a bigger pull out (but with big rocks) higher than the rest sheltered from the western winds. Enjoy!
